title: ðŸš€ Day 5: ECS Service Deployment & Validation
body:
# ðŸš€ Day 5: ECS Service Deployment & Validation

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1022 (Day 4)
**Timeline**: Friday, Nov 22, 2025
**Duration**: ~30-40 minutes
**Owner**: MUGEN (Deploy), MAJIN (Validation)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Deploy ECS service with 2 tasks
2. Validate ECS tasks start successfully
3. Verify ALB health checks passing
4. Test backend API endpoints
5. Validate database and Redis connections

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Deploy ECS Service (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
cd infrastructure/terraform/environments/dev

# Complete Terraform deployment (remaining resources)
terraform apply
```

**What Gets Created**:
- ECS Service (desired count: 2)
- Service links to ALB target group
- Auto-scaling configuration

**Monitor**:
- Service creation: ~2 min
- Tasks starting: ~3-5 min
- Health checks: ~2-3 min

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ECS service created
- [ ] 2 tasks in RUNNING state
- [ ] Service linked to ALB target group

---

### Task 2: Monitor Task Startup (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
# List tasks
aws ecs list-tasks --cluster miyabi-cluster-dev

# Describe tasks (check status)
aws ecs describe-tasks \
  --cluster miyabi-cluster-dev \
  --tasks $(aws ecs list-tasks --cluster miyabi-cluster-dev --query 'taskArns[0]' --output text)

# Stream logs
aws logs tail /aws/ecs/miyabi-dev --follow
```

**Watch For**:
- Container status: RUNNING
- Health status: HEALTHY
- No error logs

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Both tasks reach RUNNING state
- [ ] No errors in CloudWatch logs
- [ ] Application started successfully

---

### Task 3: Verify ALB Health Checks (5 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
# Check target health
TG_ARN=$(aws elbv2 describe-target-groups \
  --names miyabi-api-tg-dev \
  --query 'TargetGroups[0].TargetGroupArn' \
  --output text)

aws elbv2 describe-target-health --target-group-arn ${TG_ARN}
```

**Expected**: 2 healthy targets

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] 2/2 targets healthy
- [ ] Health check state = healthy
- [ ] No draining targets

---

### Task 4: Test Backend API (10 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

```bash
ALB_DNS=$(aws elbv2 describe-load-balancers \
  --names miyabi-alb-dev \
  --query 'LoadBalancers[0].DNSName' \
  --output text)

# Test health endpoint
curl http://${ALB_DNS}/health
# Expected: {"status":"ok","version":"1.0.0"}

# Test authentication endpoint
curl -X POST http://${ALB_DNS}/api/v1/auth/login \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"email":"test@miyabi.ai","password":"test123"}'
# Expected: JWT token or appropriate error

# Test protected endpoint (should require auth)
curl http://${ALB_DNS}/api/v1/agents
# Expected: 401 Unauthorized
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Health endpoint returns 200 OK
- [ ] Auth endpoint responds (200 or 401)
- [ ] Protected endpoints require authentication
- [ ] No 500 errors

---

### Task 5: Validate Database Connection (5 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**Check ECS task logs for database connection**:
```bash
aws logs filter-log-events \
  --log-group-name /aws/ecs/miyabi-dev \
  --filter-pattern "database" \
  --limit 10
```

**Look for**:
- "Database connected successfully"
- No connection errors
- Connection pool initialized

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Database connection successful
- [ ] No connection errors in logs
- [ ] Connection pool active

---

### Task 6: Validate Redis Connection (5 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**Check logs for Redis**:
```bash
aws logs filter-log-events \
  --log-group-name /aws/ecs/miyabi-dev \
  --filter-pattern "redis" \
  --limit 10
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Redis connection successful
- [ ] No Redis errors
- [ ] Caching operational

---

## ðŸ” Validation

**Performance Test**:
```bash
# Basic load test
ab -n 100 -c 10 http://${ALB_DNS}/health

# Check response time
curl -w "@curl-format.txt" -o /dev/null -s http://${ALB_DNS}/health
```

**Expected Performance**:
- Throughput: >50 req/sec
- Latency p95: <150ms

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 5 Deliverables

- [x] ECS service deployed (2 tasks)
- [x] All tasks RUNNING and HEALTHY
- [x] ALB health checks passing (2/2)
- [x] Backend API responding via ALB
- [x] Database connected
- [x] Redis connected
- [x] CloudWatch logs streaming
- [x] Performance within acceptable range

---

## ðŸ”— Next Step

**Day 6**: Frontend Connection & E2E Integration Testing

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17

ðŸŒ¸ Miyabi Society - Backend API Live! ðŸŒ¸

title: â˜ï¸ Day 4: Deploy ECS Cluster, ALB & Redis
body:
# â˜ï¸ Day 4: Deploy ECS Cluster, ALB & Redis (Terraform Part 2)

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1021 (Day 3)
**Timeline**: Thursday, Nov 21, 2025
**Duration**: ~40-50 minutes (includes 15 min Redis creation)
**Owner**: MUGEN (Primary), MAJIN (Validation)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Deploy ECS Fargate cluster
2. Create ECS task definition
3. Deploy Application Load Balancer
4. Deploy ElastiCache Redis cluster

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Terraform Plan (ECS, ALB, Redis) (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
cd infrastructure/terraform/environments/dev

terraform plan \
  -target=module.ecs \
  -target=module.cache \
  -out=tfplan-day4
```

**Review Output**:
- ECS Cluster
- ECS Task Definition (0.5 vCPU, 1 GB RAM)
- ALB
- ALB Target Group
- ALB Listeners (HTTP, HTTPS)
- ElastiCache Redis cluster
- CloudWatch Log Groups

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Plan shows ~15-20 resources
- [ ] Task definition references ECR image
- [ ] ALB health check path = /health
- [ ] No errors

---

### Task 2: Terraform Apply (30-40 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
terraform apply tfplan-day4
```

**Monitor Creation Timeline**:
- ECS Cluster: ~1 min
- CloudWatch Log Groups: ~1 min
- ALB: ~5 min
- ALB Target Group: ~2 min
- ALB Listeners: ~2 min
- ECS Task Definition: ~1 min
- **ElastiCache Redis**: ~15-20 min (longest wait)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ECS cluster created
- [ ] Task definition created
- [ ] ALB created and active
- [ ] Target group created
- [ ] Redis cluster status = available
- [ ] No Terraform errors

---

### Task 3: Get Resource Details (5 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
# Get ALB DNS name
ALB_DNS=$(aws elbv2 describe-load-balancers \
  --names miyabi-alb-dev \
  --query 'LoadBalancers[0].DNSName' \
  --output text)

echo "ALB DNS: ${ALB_DNS}"

# Get Redis endpoint
REDIS_ENDPOINT=$(aws elasticache describe-cache-clusters \
  --cache-cluster-id miyabi-cache-dev \
  --show-cache-node-info \
  --query 'CacheClusters[0].CacheNodes[0].Endpoint.Address' \
  --output text)

echo "Redis Endpoint: ${REDIS_ENDPOINT}"

# Document in GitHub issue comment
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ALB DNS documented
- [ ] Redis endpoint documented
- [ ] ECS cluster ARN documented

---

### Task 4: Validate Resources (5 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**ECS Cluster**:
```bash
aws ecs describe-clusters --clusters miyabi-cluster-dev
```

**ALB Status**:
```bash
aws elbv2 describe-load-balancers --names miyabi-alb-dev
```

**Redis Status**:
```bash
aws elasticache describe-cache-clusters \
  --cache-cluster-id miyabi-cache-dev \
  --show-cache-node-info
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ECS cluster status = ACTIVE
- [ ] ALB state = active
- [ ] Redis status = available
- [ ] All resources in correct VPC

---

## ðŸ” Validation

**Test ALB** (should return 503 - no healthy targets yet):
```bash
curl -I http://${ALB_DNS}/health
# Expected: HTTP/1.1 503 Service Temporarily Unavailable
```

**Test Redis Connection** (from within VPC):
```bash
redis-cli -h ${REDIS_ENDPOINT} ping
# Expected: PONG
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 4 Deliverables

- [x] ECS Fargate cluster running
- [x] ECS task definition created (0.5 vCPU, 1 GB)
- [x] ALB active with target group
- [x] ALB listeners configured (HTTP 80, HTTPS 443)
- [x] ElastiCache Redis cluster available
- [x] CloudWatch log groups created
- [x] Resource endpoints documented

---

## ðŸ”— Next Step

**Day 5**: ECS Service Deployment & Validation

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17

# ðŸŒ Day 3: Deploy VPC, Security Groups & IAM Roles (Terraform Part 1)

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1020 (Day 2)
**Timeline**: Wednesday, Nov 20, 2025  
**Duration**: ~30-40 minutes
**Owner**: MUGEN (Primary), Orchestrator (Coordination)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Initialize Terraform in dev environment
2. Deploy VPC with public/private subnets
3. Create security groups for ALB, ECS, RDS, Redis
4. Create IAM roles for ECS tasks

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Terraform Init (5 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
cd /home/ubuntu/miyabi-private/infrastructure/terraform/environments/dev

terraform init
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Terraform initialized successfully
- [ ] Providers downloaded
- [ ] Backend configured (if using remote state)

---

### Task 2: Review & Update Variables (5 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator + MUGEN

Update `terraform.tfvars`:
```hcl
project_name = "miyabi"
environment  = "dev"
aws_region   = "us-west-2"

vpc_cidr             = "10.0.0.0/16"
public_subnet_cidrs  = ["10.0.1.0/24", "10.0.2.0/24"]
private_subnet_cidrs = ["10.0.11.0/24", "10.0.12.0/24"]
availability_zones   = ["us-west-2a", "us-west-2b"]

ecr_image_uri = "112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest"
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Variables file updated
- [ ] ECR image URI correct
- [ ] Region matches ECR region

---

### Task 3: Terraform Plan (Networking & IAM) (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
terraform plan \
  -target=module.networking \
  -target=module.iam \
  -out=tfplan-day3
```

**Review Output**:
- VPC creation
- 2 public subnets
- 2 private subnets
- Internet Gateway
- NAT Gateway
- Route tables
- Security groups (4: ALB, ECS, RDS, Redis)
- IAM roles (2: ECS task execution, ECS task role)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Plan shows ~20-25 resources to create
- [ ] No errors in plan
- [ ] Security group rules correct

---

### Task 4: Terraform Apply (15-20 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
terraform apply tfplan-day3
```

**Monitor Creation**:
- VPC: ~2 min
- Subnets: ~1 min
- Internet Gateway: ~1 min
- NAT Gateway: ~5-10 min (longest)
- Security Groups: ~2 min
- IAM Roles: ~2 min

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] All resources created successfully
- [ ] No Terraform errors
- [ ] VPC ID documented
- [ ] Security group IDs documented
- [ ] IAM role ARNs documented

---

## ðŸ” Validation

**Verify VPC**:
```bash
aws ec2 describe-vpcs --filters "Name=tag:Name,Values=miyabi-vpc-dev"
```

**Verify Security Groups**:
```bash
aws ec2 describe-security-groups \
  --filters "Name=tag:Project,Values=miyabi" \
  --query 'SecurityGroups[*].[GroupId,GroupName]' \
  --output table
```

**Verify IAM Roles**:
```bash
aws iam list-roles --query 'Roles[?contains(RoleName, `miyabi`)].RoleName'
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 3 Deliverables

- [x] VPC created (10.0.0.0/16)
- [x] Public subnets (2 AZs)
- [x] Private subnets (2 AZs)
- [x] NAT Gateway running
- [x] Security groups created (ALB, ECS, RDS, Redis)
- [x] IAM roles created (task execution, task role)
- [x] Terraform state saved

---

## ðŸ”— Next Step

**Day 4**: Deploy ECS Cluster, ALB, Redis (Terraform Part 2)

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17

title: ðŸ³ Day 2: Docker Image Build & Push to ECR
body:
# ðŸ³ Day 2: Docker Image Build & Push to ECR

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1019 (Day 1)
**Timeline**: Tuesday, Nov 19, 2025
**Duration**: ~20 minutes
**Owner**: MUGEN (Primary), Mac (Fallback)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Build Docker image for miyabi-web-api
2. Tag image with latest and git SHA
3. Push image to ECR
4. Validate image in ECR

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Build Docker Image (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
cd /home/ubuntu/miyabi-private

docker buildx build \
  --platform linux/amd64 \
  -t miyabi-web-api:latest \
  -f crates/miyabi-web-api/Dockerfile \
  .
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Build completes without errors
- [ ] Build time < 15 minutes
- [ ] Image size < 500 MB

---

### Task 2: Tag Image (2 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
GIT_SHA=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)

docker tag miyabi-web-api:latest \
  112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest

docker tag miyabi-web-api:latest \
  112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:${GIT_SHA}
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Image tagged with `latest`
- [ ] Image tagged with git SHA
- [ ] Tags visible in `docker images`

---

### Task 3: ECR Login & Push (5 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
aws ecr get-login-password --region us-west-2 | \
  docker login --username AWS --password-stdin \
  112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com

docker push 112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest
docker push 112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:${GIT_SHA}
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] ECR login successful
- [ ] Both tags pushed successfully
- [ ] Push completes < 5 minutes

---

### Task 4: Validate Image (3 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

```bash
# Pull image from ECR
docker pull 112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest

# Run and test
docker run -d -p 8080:8080 --name miyabi-ecr-test \
  112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest

# Wait for startup
sleep 5

# Test health endpoint
curl http://localhost:8080/health

# Cleanup
docker stop miyabi-ecr-test && docker rm miyabi-ecr-test
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Image pulls successfully from ECR
- [ ] Container starts without errors
- [ ] Health endpoint responds 200 OK
- [ ] No runtime errors in logs

---

## ðŸ” Validation

**Verify in AWS Console**:
- ECR â†’ Repositories â†’ miyabi-web-api
- Should show 2 images (latest, git-sha)
- Image scan results (no critical vulnerabilities)

**Test Commands**:
```bash
aws ecr describe-images \
  --repository-name miyabi-web-api \
  --region us-west-2
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 2 Deliverables

- [x] Docker image built on MUGEN
- [x] Image pushed to ECR (2 tags)
- [x] Image validated by MAJIN
- [x] ECR scan completed
- [x] Ready for Terraform deployment

---

## ðŸ”— Next Step

**Day 3**: Deploy VPC, Security Groups, IAM Roles (Terraform Part 1)

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17

title: ðŸ“¦ Day 1: ECR Repository & Dockerfile Setup
body:
# ðŸ“¦ Day 1: ECR Repository & Dockerfile Setup

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Timeline**: Monday, Nov 18, 2025
**Duration**: ~30 minutes
**Owner**: MUGEN (Primary), Orchestrator (Support)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Create ECR repository for miyabi-web-api
2. Create and validate Dockerfile for backend API
3. Prepare build environment
4. Review Terraform configuration

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Create ECR Repository (5 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
aws ecr create-repository \
  --repository-name miyabi-web-api \
  --region us-west-2 \
  --image-scanning-configuration scanOnPush=true \
  --tags Key=Project,Value=miyabi Key=Environment,Value=prod
```

**Expected Output**: ECR URI `112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api`

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Repository created in us-west-2
- [ ] Image scanning enabled
- [ ] Tags applied
- [ ] URI documented

---

### Task 2: Create Dockerfile (15 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

**Location**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/Dockerfile`

**Dockerfile**:
```dockerfile
# Multi-stage build for Rust backend API

FROM rust:1.83-slim as builder
WORKDIR /build

# Install dependencies
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    pkg-config \
    libssl-dev \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy workspace
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./
COPY crates ./crates

# Build release
RUN cargo build --release --package miyabi-web-api

# Runtime stage
FROM debian:bookworm-slim
WORKDIR /app

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    ca-certificates \
    libssl3 \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

COPY --from=builder /build/target/release/miyabi-web-api /app/miyabi-web-api

EXPOSE 8080

HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=3s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:8080/health || exit 1

CMD ["/app/miyabi-web-api"]
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Dockerfile created in correct location
- [ ] Multi-stage build (builder + runtime)
- [ ] Health check included
- [ ] Tested locally (builds without errors)

---

### Task 3: Test Docker Build Locally (10 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

```bash
cd /Users/shunsuke/Dev/01-miyabi/_core/miyabi-private

docker build -t miyabi-web-api:local -f crates/miyabi-web-api/Dockerfile .
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Build completes successfully
- [ ] No compilation errors
- [ ] Image size reasonable (<500 MB)
- [ ] Can run locally: `docker run -p 8080:8080 miyabi-web-api:local`

---

## ðŸ” Validation

**Success Indicators**:
- ECR repository exists and accessible
- Dockerfile builds successfully
- Local Docker image runs
- Health endpoint responds

**Test Commands**:
```bash
# Verify ECR repo
aws ecr describe-repositories --repository-names miyabi-web-api

# Test local image
docker run -d -p 8080:8080 --name miyabi-test miyabi-web-api:local
curl http://localhost:8080/health
docker stop miyabi-test && docker rm miyabi-test
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 1 Deliverables

- [x] ECR repository created
- [x] Dockerfile created
- [x] Docker build tested locally
- [x] Build environment ready for Day 2

---

## ðŸ”— Next Step

**Day 2**: Docker Image Build & Push to ECR

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17
**Status**: Ready to execute

# ðŸš€ M1 Infrastructure Blitz - Production Deployment

**Epic Owner**: Layer 2 - Orchestrator (Mac Agent)
**Timeline**: 7 days (Nov 18-24, 2025)
**Objective**: Deploy production AWS infrastructure for Miyabi M1 (Private Alpha)

---

## ðŸ“Š Overview

This epic tracks the complete Infrastructure Blitz to deploy Miyabi backend API to AWS ECS with full production infrastructure.

**Current Status**: 65% M1 complete
- âœ… Product code ready (Frontend + Backend)
- âŒ Infrastructure missing (ECS, ALB, Redis)

**Goal**: 100% M1 infrastructure deployed

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Success Criteria

- [ ] ECR repository miyabi-web-api created
- [ ] Docker image built and pushed to ECR
- [ ] ECS Fargate cluster running (2+ tasks)
- [ ] Application Load Balancer with HTTPS
- [ ] ElastiCache Redis cluster running
- [ ] Backend API accessible via ALB
- [ ] Health checks passing
- [ ] Database connected
- [ ] Frontend connected to backend
- [ ] API latency p95 < 100ms
- [ ] CloudWatch monitoring active

---

## ðŸ“‹ Child Issues (7-Day Timeline)

This epic breaks down into daily execution issues:

**Day 1 - Preparation**
**Day 2 - Docker Build**
**Day 3 - Infrastructure Part 1**
**Day 4 - Infrastructure Part 2**
**Day 5 - Service Deployment**
**Day 6 - Integration**
**Day 7 - Finalization**

Plus testing and CI/CD issues.

---

## ðŸ’° Budget

**Monthly Cost**: ~$200/month (Dev Environment)

---

## ðŸ“ž Team

- **Orchestrator (Mac)**: Planning, coordination
- **MUGEN (US West)**: Docker, Terraform
- **MAJIN (Tokyo)**: Testing, validation

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17
**Target**: 2025-11-24

# ðŸ—ï¸ Miyabi Society - Ultra-Detailed Reconstruction Plan

**Version**: 1.0.0
**Created**: 2025-11-17
**Planning Authority**: Layer 2 - Orchestrator
**Scope**: Complete System Reconstruction - Database, Backend API, Frontend Integration
**Estimated Duration**: 4-6 weeks
**Estimated Effort**: 160-200 hours

**Related Issues**:
- #969 - ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆæ§‹é€ ã®æ ¹æœ¬çš„ãªå•é¡Œèª¿æŸ»ã¨æ”¹å–„ææ¡ˆ
- #964 - Kazuaki Agent Improvement (parallel execution reference)

---

## ðŸ“‹ Executive Summary

### Current State (ç¾çŠ¶)

```
ðŸ”´ Critical Issues:
â”œâ”€â”€ Database Layer: 40% implemented (PostgreSQL connection skipped)
â”œâ”€â”€ Organization/Tenant Management: 0% (not started)
â”œâ”€â”€ Dashboard Backend API: 20% (localhost hardcoded)

ðŸŸ¢ Working Components:
```

### Target State (ç›®æ¨™çŠ¶æ…‹)

```
âœ… Fully Operational System:

â”œâ”€â”€ Organization Management: 100% (RBAC + Team management)

â””â”€â”€ Agent System: 100% (All 22 agents operational)
```

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Strategic Approach

### Reconstruction Strategy: **Phased Rollout with Zero Downtime**

**Core Principles**:
1. **Incremental Implementation** - æ®µéšŽçš„å®Ÿè£…ã§å¸¸ã«å‹•ä½œçŠ¶æ…‹ã‚’ç¶­æŒ
2. **Parallel Development** - ç‹¬ç«‹ã—ãŸã‚³ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ãƒˆã¯ä¸¦è¡Œé–‹ç™º
3. **Continuous Validation** - å„ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒƒãƒ—ã§æ¤œè¨¼ã‚’å®Ÿæ–½

#### 0.1.3 âœ… Risk Assessment & Mitigation Plan (2h)

**Identified Risks**:

| Risk ID | Risk Description | Probability | Impact | Mitigation Strategy |
|---------|-----------------|-------------|--------|---------------------|
| R1 | Database migration fails | Medium | High | Test migrations on staging first |
| R2 | Lambda cold start latency | High | Medium | Provisioned concurrency for critical APIs |
| R3 | API Gateway rate limits | Low | High | Implement caching + retry logic |
| R4 | PostgreSQL connection pool exhaustion | Medium | High | Configure max connections properly |
| R5 | Breaking changes to Telegram Bot | Low | Critical | Keep Telegram routes isolated |
| R6 | CloudFront cache invalidation delays | High | Low | Accept 5-min delay, or use versioned URLs |
| R7 | Budget overrun | Medium | Medium | Monitor costs daily, set billing alerts |
| R8 | Timeline delay due to complexity | High | Medium | Build buffer time, parallel execution |

**Mitigation Plan**:

**R1: Database Migration Failure**
```bash
# Mitigation
1. Create staging database first
2. Test all migrations on staging
3. Create database backup before production migration
4. Have rollback script ready

# Rollback Procedure
psql -U postgres -d miyabi_production < backup_YYYYMMDD.sql
```

**R2: Lambda Cold Start**
```yaml
# Mitigation
- Use provisioned concurrency for /api/v1/tasks (critical)
- Implement Lambda warming schedule (every 5 min)
- Keep Lambda size small (<50MB)

# Cost Impact
Provisioned concurrency: 1 instance = ~$10/mo additional
```

**R5: Telegram Bot Breaking Changes**
```rust
// Mitigation: Keep Telegram routes completely isolated
// Current implementation already correct:
let api_routes = Router::new()
    .route("/health", get(routes::health::health_check))
    .route("/telegram/webhook", post(routes::telegram::handle_webhook))
    // New routes added below - Telegram unaffected
    .route("/tasks", post(routes::tasks::create_task))
    .route("/tasks", get(routes::tasks::list_tasks));
```

#### 0.3.3 âœ… Rollback Procedures (2h)

**Phase 1 Rollback** (Database):

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# rollback_phase1.sh

echo "Rolling back Phase 1 - Database Foundation"

# 1. Backup current state first
pg_dump -U miyabi_admin -h <RDS_ENDPOINT> miyabi > rollback_backup_$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).sql

# 2. Revert migrations
cd crates/miyabi-web-api
sqlx migrate revert --database-url $DATABASE_URL

# 3. Restore original code (revert lib.rs changes)
git checkout main -- crates/miyabi-web-api/src/lib.rs

# 4. Rebuild
cargo build --release --bin miyabi-web-api

# 5. Verify Telegram bot still works
curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/v1/health
# Expected: {"status":"healthy"}

echo "âœ… Rollback complete. Telegram bot functionality preserved."
```

**Phase 2 Rollback** (Backend API):

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# rollback_phase2.sh

echo "Rolling back Phase 2 - Backend API Deployment"

# 1. Delete Lambda functions
aws lambda delete-function --function-name miyabi-api-tasks
aws lambda delete-function --function-name miyabi-api-workers
aws lambda delete-function --function-name miyabi-api-coordinators

# 2. Delete API Gateway
aws apigatewayv2 delete-api --api-id <API_ID>

# 3. Revert CloudFront origin (if changed)
# (Manual step - update CloudFront to use S3 origin only)

# 4. Database remains unchanged (Phase 1 kept)

echo "âœ… Rollback complete. API removed, database preserved."
```

**Phase 3 Rollback** (Frontend):

```bash
#!/bin/bash
# rollback_phase3.sh

echo "Rolling back Phase 3 - Frontend Integration"

# 1. Restore previous CloudFront deployment
aws s3 sync s3://miyabi-webui-backup-YYYYMMDD/ s3://miyabi-webui-112530848482/

# 2. Invalidate CloudFront cache
aws cloudfront create-invalidation \
  --distribution-id E1FF97QM8U71OR \
  --paths "/*"

# 3. Wait for invalidation to complete (5-10 min)
aws cloudfront wait invalidation-completed \
  --distribution-id E1FF97QM8U71OR \
  --id <INVALIDATION_ID>

echo "âœ… Rollback complete. Frontend restored to previous version."
```

#### 1.1.2 âœ… Connection Pool Configuration & Tuning (2h)

**Objective**: Optimize connection pool for Lambda + RDS

**Configuration Strategy**:

```rust
// crates/miyabi-web-api/src/database.rs
use sqlx::postgres::PgPoolOptions;
use std::time::Duration;

pub async fn create_pool(database_url: &str) -> Result<sqlx::PgPool, sqlx::Error> {
    let pool = PgPoolOptions::new()
        // Max connections: Lower for Lambda to avoid overwhelming RDS
        .max_connections(20)

        // Min connections: Keep 2 warm for fast response
        .min_connections(2)

        // Acquire timeout: 5s is reasonable for Lambda
        .acquire_timeout(Duration::from_secs(5))

        // Idle timeout: Close connections after 10 min idle
        .idle_timeout(Some(Duration::from_secs(600)))

        // Max lifetime: Recycle connections after 30 min
        .max_lifetime(Some(Duration::from_secs(1800)))

        // Test connections before using
        .test_before_acquire(true)

        .connect(database_url)
        .await?;

    Ok(pool)
}
```

**RDS Configuration**:

```sql
-- Connect to RDS and configure
psql -U miyabi_admin -h <RDS_ENDPOINT> miyabi

-- Set max connections (db.t3.small default: 87)
ALTER SYSTEM SET max_connections = 100;

-- Set shared buffers (25% of RAM = 512MB for 2GB instance)
ALTER SYSTEM SET shared_buffers = '512MB';

-- Enable connection pooling stats
ALTER SYSTEM SET log_connections = 'on';
ALTER SYSTEM SET log_disconnections = 'on';

-- Reload configuration
SELECT pg_reload_conf();

-- Verify settings
SHOW max_connections;
SHOW shared_buffers;
```

**Deliverables**:
- âœ… database.rs with optimized pool config
- âœ… RDS PostgreSQL configured
- âœ… Connection pool tested under load

**Load Testing**:
```bash
# Install wrk (HTTP load testing tool)

# Test with 100 concurrent connections
wrk -t 10 -c 100 -d 30s http://localhost:8080/api/v1/health

# Monitor connection pool
# (Add metrics endpoint to expose pool stats)
curl http://localhost:8080/api/v1/metrics | grep db_pool
```

**Validation**:

- [ ] No connection timeout errors in logs

#### 1.1.3 âœ… Database Health Check Implementation (1h)

**Objective**: Add comprehensive health check for database

**File**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/routes/health.rs`

**Enhanced Health Check**:
```rust
use axum::{extract::State, Json};
use serde::Serialize;
use crate::AppState;

#[derive(Serialize)]
pub struct HealthResponse {
    pub status: String,
    pub database: DatabaseHealth,
    pub version: String,
}

#[derive(Serialize)]
pub struct DatabaseHealth {
    pub connected: bool,
    pub latency_ms: u64,
    pub active_connections: u32,
    pub idle_connections: u32,
}

pub async fn health_check(State(state): State<AppState>) -> Json<HealthResponse> {
    let start = std::time::Instant::now();

    // Test database connection
    let db_connected = sqlx::query("SELECT 1")
        .fetch_one(&state.db)
        .await
        .is_ok();

    let latency = start.elapsed().as_millis() as u64;

    // Get connection pool stats
    let pool_size = state.db.size();
    let idle_count = state.db.num_idle();
    let active_count = pool_size - idle_count;

    Json(HealthResponse {
        status: if db_connected { "healthy".to_string() } else { "unhealthy".to_string() },
        database: DatabaseHealth {
            connected: db_connected,
            latency_ms: latency,
            active_connections: active_count,
            idle_connections: idle_count,
        },
        version: env!("CARGO_PKG_VERSION").to_string(),
    })
}
```

**Testing**:
```bash
# Test health endpoint
curl http://localhost:8080/api/v1/health | jq .

# Expected output:
{
  "status": "healthy",
  "database": {
    "connected": true,
    "latency_ms": 15,
    "active_connections": 2,
    "idle_connections": 2
  },
  "version": "1.1.0"
}
```

**Deliverables**:
- âœ… Enhanced health check endpoint
- âœ… Database latency monitoring
- âœ… Connection pool stats exposed

**Validation**:
- [ ] /api/v1/health returns 200 with database stats
- [ ] Database latency < 50ms
- [ ] Connection pool stats accurate

#### 1.2.2 âœ… Verify Schema Integrity (2h)

**Verification Script**:

```rust
// crates/miyabi-web-api/tests/schema_verification.rs
#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    use sqlx::PgPool;
    use miyabi_web_api::models::*;

    #[sqlx::test]
    async fn test_users_table_schema(pool: PgPool) {
        // Test User model can be inserted and retrieved
        let user = User {
            id: uuid::Uuid::new_v4(),
            github_id: 123456,
            email: "test@example.com".to_string(),
            name: Some("Test User".to_string()),
            avatar_url: Some("https://example.com/avatar.png".to_string()),
            access_token: "test_token".to_string(),
            created_at: chrono::Utc::now(),
            updated_at: chrono::Utc::now(),
        };

        // Insert
        sqlx::query!(
            "INSERT INTO users (id, github_id, email, name, avatar_url, access_token, created_at, updated_at)
             VALUES ($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7, $8)",
            user.id, user.github_id, user.email, user.name, user.avatar_url, user.access_token, user.created_at, user.updated_at
        )
        .execute(&pool)
        .await
        .expect("Failed to insert user");

        // Retrieve
        let retrieved = sqlx::query_as!(
            User,
            "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = $1",
            user.id
        )
        .fetch_one(&pool)
        .await
        .expect("Failed to retrieve user");

        assert_eq!(retrieved.github_id, user.github_id);
        assert_eq!(retrieved.email, user.email);
    }

    #[sqlx::test]
    async fn test_repositories_table_schema(pool: PgPool) {
        // Similar test for repositories
        // ... (implementation)
    }

    // Add tests for all other tables
}
```

title: ðŸ” [Miyabi Console] Authentication & Authorization
body:
# ðŸ” Authentication & Authorization

## ðŸ“‹ Overview

Implement comprehensive authentication and role-based authorization for Miyabi Console to secure access and enable multi-user environments.

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

- Secure all console pages with authentication
- Implement JWT-based authentication
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Secure token storage
- Session management

## ðŸ“¦ Scope

### Authentication Features
- Login page with email/password
- Logout functionality
- Token refresh mechanism
- "Remember Me" option
- Password reset flow (Phase 2)

### Authorization Roles
- **Admin**: Full access to all features
- **Developer**: Read/write access, no system settings
- **Viewer**: Read-only access

### Protected Resources
- Dashboard: All roles
- Agents: Admin, Developer (read-only for Viewer)
- Database: Admin, Developer
- Deployment: Admin only
- Infrastructure: Admin only
- Settings: Admin only

## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Auth Infrastructure (1.5h)
- [ ] Create auth context/provider
- [ ] Implement login page
- [ ] Add protected route component
- [ ] Setup token storage (secure)
- [ ] Create auth service

### Phase 2: Login Flow (1h)
- [ ] Design login page UI
- [ ] Implement login form
- [ ] Add form validation
- [ ] Handle login errors
- [ ] Redirect after login

### Phase 3: Token Management (1h)
- [ ] Store JWT in httpOnly cookie or localStorage
- [ ] Add token to API requests (interceptor)
- [ ] Implement token refresh
- [ ] Handle token expiration
- [ ] Auto-logout on expiry

### Phase 4: Authorization (1h)
- [ ] Parse user role from JWT
- [ ] Implement role checks
- [ ] Add permission guards to routes
- [ ] Hide UI elements based on role
- [ ] Add unauthorized page (403)

### Phase 5: Logout & Session (30m)
- [ ] Implement logout functionality
- [ ] Clear tokens on logout
- [ ] Session timeout warning
- [ ] Idle timeout

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

### Authentication
- [ ] Users must login to access console
- [ ] Invalid credentials show error message
- [ ] Successful login redirects to dashboard
- [ ] Token stored securely
- [ ] Token included in all API requests
- [ ] Token refreshed before expiry
- [ ] Auto-logout after token expires

### Authorization
- [ ] Admin has full access
- [ ] Developer has limited access (no settings, deployment)
- [ ] Viewer has read-only access
- [ ] Unauthorized actions show 403 error
- [ ] UI hides features based on role

### Security
- [ ] Passwords not stored in plaintext
- [ ] JWT signed with secret key
- [ ] HTTPS enforced in production
- [ ] CSRF protection implemented
- [ ] XSS protection (sanitize inputs)

## ðŸ“Š Estimated Time

**Total**: 4-5 hours
- Infrastructure: 1.5h
- Login Flow: 1h
- Token Management: 1h
- Authorization: 1h
- Logout/Session: 30m

## ðŸ”— Implementation Details

### Auth Context
```typescript
interface AuthContext {
  user: User | null
  login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>
  logout: () => void
  isAuthenticated: boolean
  hasRole: (role: Role) => boolean
}
```

### Protected Route
```typescript
<Route
  path="/settings"
  element={
    <ProtectedRoute requiredRole="admin">
      <SettingsPage />
    </ProtectedRoute>
  }
/>
```

### JWT Structure
```json
{
  "sub": "user123",
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "role": "admin",
  "exp": 1700000000
}
```

### API Integration
```typescript
// Request interceptor
axios.interceptors.request.use((config) => {
  const token = getToken()
  if (token) {
    config.headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`
  }
  return config
})

// Response interceptor
axios.interceptors.response.use(
  (response) => response,
  async (error) => {
    if (error.response?.status === 401) {
      // Token expired, try refresh
      const newToken = await refreshToken()
      if (newToken) {
        // Retry original request
        return axios(error.config)
      }
      // Refresh failed, logout
      logout()
    }
    return Promise.reject(error)
  }
)
```

## ðŸ“ Login Page Design

### Features
- Email/password inputs
- "Remember Me" checkbox
- Login button with loading state
- Error message display
- Forgot password link (Phase 2)
- Background gradient matching theme

### Validation Rules
- Email: Valid email format
- Password: Minimum 8 characters

## ðŸ” Security Best Practices

1. **Token Storage**
   - Production: httpOnly cookies
   - Development: localStorage (easier debugging)

2. **Token Expiry**
   - Access token: 15 minutes
   - Refresh token: 7 days

3. **HTTPS**
   - Enforce HTTPS in production
   - Redirect HTTP â†’ HTTPS

4. **CORS**
   - Whitelist frontend domain
   - Include credentials in requests

## ðŸŽ¯ Post-Implementation

### Future Enhancements
- [ ] OAuth integration (GitHub, Google)
- [ ] Two-factor authentication (2FA)
- [ ] Password reset via email
- [ ] Account registration flow
- [ ] Audit logging
- [ ] Session management UI

## ðŸ“Š Role Permissions Matrix

| Feature | Admin | Developer | Viewer |
|---------|-------|-----------|--------|
| Dashboard | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| View Agents | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| Start/Stop Agents | âœ… | âœ… | âŒ |
| Database View | âœ… | âœ… | âœ… |
| Database Query | âœ… | âœ… | âŒ |
| Export Data | âœ… | âœ… | âŒ |
| Deploy | âœ… | âŒ | âŒ |
| Infrastructure | âœ… | âœ… (read) | âŒ |
| Settings | âœ… | âŒ | âŒ |

## ðŸ”— Backend Requirements

Backend must implement:
- `POST /api/v1/auth/login` - Login endpoint
- `POST /api/v1/auth/refresh` - Refresh token
- `POST /api/v1/auth/logout` - Logout endpoint
- JWT signing/verification
- Role-based middleware

title: ðŸ”Œ [Miyabi Console] Rust Backend API Integration
body:
# ðŸ”Œ Rust Backend API Integration

## ðŸ“‹ Overview

Connect Miyabi Console frontend to the Rust backend API (`miyabi-web-api`) to replace mock data with real system data.

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

- Replace mock data in all pages with real API calls
- Implement error handling and retry logic
- Add loading states and error boundaries
- Configure API endpoint management

## ðŸ“¦ Scope

### Pages to Connect
- âœ… Dashboard Page â†’ `/api/v1/system/metrics`
- âœ… Agents Page â†’ `/api/v1/agents`
- âœ… Database Page â†’ `/api/v1/database`
- âœ… Deployment Page â†’ `/api/v1/deployments`
- âœ… Infrastructure Page â†’ `/api/v1/infrastructure`

### API Client Enhancements
- HTTP client configuration (axios)
- Request/response interceptors
- Error handling middleware
- Retry logic with exponential backoff
- Request timeout configuration
- Response caching

## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: API Client Setup (1h)
- [ ] Configure axios instance with base URL
- [ ] Add request/response interceptors
- [ ] Implement retry logic
- [ ] Add timeout configuration
- [ ] Create error handler utility

### Phase 2: Dashboard Integration (30m)
- [ ] Replace mock metrics with API call
- [ ] Add loading states
- [ ] Handle API errors gracefully
- [ ] Update real-time refresh logic

### Phase 3: Agents Page Integration (30m)
- [ ] Connect agent list API
- [ ] Implement agent start/stop API calls
- [ ] Add agent metrics API
- [ ] Connect logs API

### Phase 4: Database Integration (30m)
- [ ] Connect database schema API
- [ ] Implement query execution API
- [ ] Add export/import API endpoints

### Phase 5: Other Pages (1h)
- [ ] Deployment page API integration
- [ ] Infrastructure page API integration

### Phase 6: Testing & Error Handling (30m)
- [ ] Test all API endpoints
- [ ] Verify error handling
- [ ] Test retry logic
- [ ] Test timeout scenarios

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] All mock data replaced with real API calls
- [ ] Loading states display during API calls
- [ ] Errors handled gracefully with user-friendly messages
- [ ] Retry logic works for transient failures
- [ ] Request timeout configured (default: 30s)
- [ ] API endpoint configurable via Settings page
- [ ] No console errors during normal operation
- [ ] Build succeeds without errors
- [ ] All pages render data from API

## ðŸ“Š Estimated Time

**Total**: 3-4 hours
- API Client Setup: 1h
- Dashboard: 30m
- Agents: 30m
- Database: 30m
- Other Pages: 1h
- Testing: 30m

## ðŸ”— Related

- Backend API: `crates/miyabi-web-api/`
- Frontend Client: `miyabi-console/src/lib/api/client.ts`
- Settings: `miyabi-console/src/pages/SettingsPage.tsx`

## ðŸ“ Notes

- Enable mock data toggle in Settings for development
- API endpoint: `http://localhost:8080/api/v1`
- Ensure CORS is configured in backend

title: âš™ï¸ CI/CD Pipeline: GitHub Actions Setup
body:
# âš™ï¸ CI/CD Pipeline: GitHub Actions Setup

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Timeline**: Week 2 (Nov 30 - Dec 1, 2025)
**Duration**: ~6-8 hours
**Owner**: MUGEN (Primary), Orchestrator (Support)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Setup automated testing on PR
2. Setup automated deployment to ECS
3. Setup automated frontend deployment
4. Configure environment secrets

---

## âœ… Workflows to Create

### 1. Test Workflow (`.github/workflows/test.yml`)

**Triggers**: PR to main, push to main

```yaml
name: Test

on:
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
  push:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  backend-test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions-rs/toolchain@v1
        with:
          toolchain: stable
      - run: cargo test --workspace
      - run: cargo tarpaulin --out Xml
      - uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3

  frontend-test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 18
      - run: cd miyabi-console && npm ci
      - run: cd miyabi-console && npm test
```

---

### 2. Deploy Backend (`.github/workflows/deploy-backend.yml`)

**Triggers**: Push to main (after tests pass)

```yaml
name: Deploy Backend

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
    paths:
      - 'crates/miyabi-web-api/**'

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      
      - name: Configure AWS credentials
        uses: aws-actions/configure-aws-credentials@v2
        with:
          aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
          aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
          aws-region: us-west-2

      - name: Login to ECR
        run: |
          aws ecr get-login-password --region us-west-2 | \
            docker login --username AWS --password-stdin \
            112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com

      - name: Build and push Docker image
        run: |
          docker build -t miyabi-web-api:${{ github.sha }} \
            -f crates/miyabi-web-api/Dockerfile .
          
          docker tag miyabi-web-api:${{ github.sha }} \
            112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest
          
          docker push 112530848482.dkr.ecr.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/miyabi-web-api:latest

      - name: Update ECS service
        run: |
          aws ecs update-service \
            --cluster miyabi-cluster-dev \
            --service miyabi-web-api-service-dev \
            --force-new-deployment
```

---

### 3. Deploy Frontend (`.github/workflows/deploy-frontend.yml`)

**Triggers**: Push to main

```yaml
name: Deploy Frontend

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
    paths:
      - 'miyabi-console/**'

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 18
      
      - name: Build
        run: |
          cd miyabi-console
          npm ci
          npm run build

      - name: Deploy to S3
        run: |
          aws s3 sync miyabi-console/dist/ s3://miyabi-console-bucket/

      - name: Invalidate CloudFront
        run: |
          aws cloudfront create-invalidation \
            --distribution-id ${{ secrets.CLOUDFRONT_DIST_ID }} \
            --paths "/*"
```

---

## ðŸ” GitHub Secrets to Configure

Add to repository secrets:
- [ ] `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID`
- [ ] `AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`
- [ ] `CLOUDFRONT_DIST_ID`
- [ ] `DATABASE_URL` (for tests)
- [ ] `JWT_SECRET` (for tests)

---

## âœ… Success Criteria

- [ ] Test workflow runs on every PR
- [ ] Backend deployment automated (push to main)
- [ ] Frontend deployment automated (push to main)
- [ ] All secrets configured
- [ ] Workflows tested and passing
- [ ] Deployment notifications (Slack/Lark)

---

## ðŸ“ Deliverables

- [x] 3 GitHub Actions workflows
- [x] Secrets configured
- [x] Automated testing on PR
- [x] Automated deployment on merge
- [x] Zero-downtime deployments (ECS rolling update)

---

**Created**: 2025-11-17
**Target**: 2025-12-01

title: ðŸ”— Day 6: Frontend Connection & E2E Integration Testing
body:
# ðŸ”— Day 6: Frontend Connection & E2E Integration Testing

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1023 (Day 5)
**Timeline**: Saturday, Nov 23, 2025
**Duration**: ~45-60 minutes
**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac), MAJIN (Testing)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Update Miyabi Console to connect to backend API
2. Rebuild and redeploy frontend
3. Conduct end-to-end integration testing
4. Setup CloudWatch monitoring
5. Validate all critical user flows

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: Update Frontend Environment Variables (5 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

**File**: `miyabi-console/.env.production`

```env
VITE_API_BASE_URL=http://<ALB_DNS>
VITE_WS_URL=ws://<ALB_DNS>/ws
```

Replace `<ALB_DNS>` with actual ALB DNS from Day 4.

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Environment file updated
- [ ] API URL correct
- [ ] WebSocket URL correct

---

### Task 2: Rebuild Miyabi Console (10 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

```bash
cd miyabi-console

# Install dependencies (if needed)
npm install

# Build production bundle
npm run build

# Verify build output
ls -lh dist/
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Build completes successfully
- [ ] No TypeScript errors
- [ ] Build size reasonable (<5 MB)
- [ ] dist/ directory created

---

### Task 3: Deploy Frontend (10 min)

**Option A: S3 + CloudFront** (if using):
```bash
# Upload to S3
aws s3 sync dist/ s3://miyabi-console-bucket/

# Invalidate CloudFront cache
aws cloudfront create-invalidation \
  --distribution-id <DIST_ID> \
  --paths "/*"
```

**Option B: Local Testing**:
```bash
npm run preview
# Opens on http://localhost:4173
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Frontend deployed successfully
- [ ] Accessible via browser
- [ ] No deployment errors

---

### Task 4: E2E Integration Testing (20 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**Test 1: Login Flow**
- [ ] Navigate to Console URL
- [ ] Should redirect to /login
- [ ] Enter credentials: admin@miyabi.ai / password123
- [ ] Click Login
- [ ] Should redirect to Dashboard
- [ ] **Expected**: Login successful, JWT token stored

**Test 2: Dashboard**
- [ ] Dashboard loads without errors
- [ ] Agent hierarchy displays
- [ ] System metrics cards show data
- [ ] Recent alerts section renders
- [ ] **Expected**: All components render, no API errors

**Test 3: Tasks Page**
- [ ] Navigate to /tasks
- [ ] Task list loads
- [ ] Click "+ New Task"
- [ ] Fill form: Title, Description, Priority
- [ ] Submit task creation
- [ ] New task appears in list
- [ ] **Expected**: Task created successfully

**Test 4: Logs Page**
- [ ] Navigate to /logs
- [ ] Real-time logs stream
- [ ] Filter by log level
- [ ] Search functionality works
- [ ] **Expected**: Logs streaming, filters working

**Test 5: Analytics Page**
- [ ] Navigate to /analytics
- [ ] Charts render
- [ ] Metrics display
- [ ] Date range selector works
- [ ] **Expected**: Charts display data

**Test 6: WebSocket Real-time Updates**
- [ ] Open Dashboard
- [ ] Create task in another browser tab
- [ ] **Expected**: Dashboard updates in real-time

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] All 6 tests passing
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] No API 500 errors
- [ ] WebSocket connects successfully

---

### Task 5: Browser Compatibility Testing (10 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

Test on:
- [ ] Chrome (latest)
- [ ] Firefox (latest)
- [ ] Safari (latest)

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Works on all 3 browsers
- [ ] No browser-specific errors
- [ ] UI renders correctly

---

### Task 6: CloudWatch Monitoring Setup (10 min)

**Owner**: MUGEN

```bash
# Create CloudWatch dashboard
aws cloudwatch put-dashboard \
  --dashboard-name miyabi-dev-dashboard \
  --dashboard-body file://cloudwatch-dashboard.json

# Create alarms
aws cloudwatch put-metric-alarm \
  --alarm-name miyabi-dev-ecs-cpu-high \
  --alarm-description "ECS CPU > 80%" \
  --metric-name CPUUtilization \
  --namespace AWS/ECS \
  --statistic Average \
  --period 300 \
  --threshold 80 \
  --comparison-operator GreaterThanThreshold

# Similar alarms for Memory, ALB 5xx, API latency
```

**Acceptance Criteria**:

**Route:** `/ask`

**Project:** The Pantheon Project

**URL:** https://d3ev2zsrbkwq8v.cloudfront.net

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create an interactive AI consultation page where authenticated users can ask questions and receive wisdom from historical advisors powered by Claude AI. This is the premium feature that brings The Pantheon Project to life.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] Question input (text area)
- [ ] Advisor selection (All or specific advisors)

- [ ] Synthesize combined wisdom from multiple advisors
- [ ] Save consultation history
- [ ] Share consultation results

- [ ] Context preservation across questions

### API Integration
- Claude API for generating advisor responses
- Prompt engineering for each historical figure
- Response synthesis from multiple advisors

- [ ] Users can select specific advisors or "All"
- [ ] Submit button is disabled while loading

- [ ] Share button generates shareable link

title: [Miyabi Console] Implement Agents Page - Agent Management & Configuration
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/agents`
**Priority:** P1 (High Priority)
**Estimated Time:** 4-6 hours
**Project:** Miyabi Console
**Tech Stack:** React 18, TypeScript, HeroUI, Tailwind, Vite

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create a comprehensive agent management page that displays all agents in the Miyabi Society hierarchy organized by layer, with capabilities for monitoring, configuration, and control.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] List all agents organized by layer (Layer 0-4)
- [ ] Display real-time agent status (Active, Idle, Error, Offline)
- [ ] Show agent uptime and performance metrics
- [ ] Display active and completed task counts per agent
- [ ] Agent details modal/panel
- [ ] Start/Stop agent controls
- [ ] Configure agent settings
- [ ] View agent-specific logs
- [ ] Agent performance metrics visualization

### UI Layout

```

```

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure
- **Main Component:** `miyabi-console/src/pages/AgentsPage.tsx`
- **Sub-components:**
  - `AgentCard.tsx` - Individual agent card display
  - `AgentDetailModal.tsx` - Detailed agent information
  - `AgentControls.tsx` - Start/stop/configure controls
  - `LayerSection.tsx` - Agents grouped by layer

### State Management
```typescript
interface AgentsPageState {
  agents: Agent[];
  selectedAgent: Agent | null;
  isLoading: boolean;
  filterLayer?: number;
  sortBy: 'name' | 'status' | 'uptime' | 'tasks';
}

interface Agent {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  layer: number;
  status: 'active' | 'idle' | 'error' | 'offline';
  uptime: number;
  tasks: {
    active: number;
    completed: number;
  };
  metrics: AgentMetrics;
  config: AgentConfig;
}
```

### API Endpoints Required
- `GET /api/v1/agents` - Fetch all agents
- `GET /api/v1/agents/:id` - Get agent details
- `POST /api/v1/agents/:id/configure` - Update agent configuration
- `POST /api/v1/agents/:id/start` - Start agent
- `POST /api/v1/agents/:id/stop` - Stop agent
- `GET /api/v1/agents/:id/metrics` - Get agent performance metrics
- `GET /api/v1/agents/:id/logs` - Get agent logs

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Page displays all agents organized by hierarchy layers
- [ ] Real-time status indicators update every 5 seconds
- [ ] Agent cards show uptime, task counts, and status
- [ ] Clicking an agent opens detailed modal with full information
- [ ] Configure button opens agent settings editor
- [ ] Start/Stop controls work and update status in real-time
- [ ] Agent metrics are displayed with charts
- [ ] Logs viewer shows recent agent activity
- [ ] Responsive design works on mobile and desktop
- [ ] Loading states are implemented
- [ ] Error handling for API failures

## ðŸ“ Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Setup (1 hour)
- [ ] Create `AgentsPage.tsx` file
- [ ] Setup routing in `App.tsx`
- [ ] Create basic layout structure

### Phase 2: Components (2 hours)
- [ ] Implement `AgentCard` component
- [ ] Implement `LayerSection` component
- [ ] Create `AgentDetailModal` component
- [ ] Build `AgentControls` component

### Phase 3: API Integration (1-2 hours)
- [ ] Create API client methods for agent endpoints
- [ ] Implement real-time status polling
- [ ] Add WebSocket support for live updates

### Phase 4: Styling & Polish (1 hour)
- [ ] Apply HeroUI components
- [ ] Responsive design implementation
- [ ] Add animations and transitions
- [ ] Implement loading skeletons

### Phase 5: Testing (1 hour)
- [ ] Unit tests for components
- [ ] Integration tests for API calls
- [ ] Manual QA testing

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/miyabi-console-pages-plan.md`
- Existing Dashboard: `miyabi-console/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx`
- API Client: `miyabi-console/src/lib/api/client.ts`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

- Backend API endpoints must be implemented
- HeroUI components library
- Recharts for metrics visualization
- React Query for data fetching

title: Phase 1.5: JWT Authentication Implementation
body:
# Phase 1.5: JWT Authentication Implementation

**Parent Issue**: #970
**Phase**: Phase 1 - Database Foundation
**Duration**: 8-12 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)

## Objectives
- Implement JWT token generation and validation
- Implement GitHub OAuth flow
- Enable authentication routes

## Tasks
1. Implement JWT service (3h)
2. Implement GitHub OAuth routes (4h)
3. Test authentication end-to-end (2h)

## Features
- JWT access tokens (7-day expiry)
- JWT refresh tokens (30-day expiry)
- GitHub OAuth 2.0 integration
- User creation/update on login

## Routes to Enable
- `POST /api/v1/auth/github` - GitHub OAuth redirect
- `GET /api/v1/auth/github/callback` - OAuth callback
- `POST /api/v1/auth/refresh` - Refresh access token

## JWT Claims
```json
{
  "sub": "user_id",
  "exp": 1234567890,
  "iat": 1234567890,
  "github_id": 12345,
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "org_id": "optional_org_uuid"
}
```

## Success Criteria
- [ ] JWT service implemented
- [ ] GitHub OAuth flow works end-to-end
- [ ] User creation/update on login
- [ ] Refresh token working
- [ ] All auth tests pass

**Detailed Plan**: `/tmp/phase1-database-foundation-detailed-plan.md` (Section 1.5)

title: Phase 1.4: RBAC Implementation
body:
# Phase 1.4: RBAC Implementation

**Parent Issue**: #970
**Phase**: Phase 1 - Database Foundation
**Duration**: 12-16 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)

## Objectives
- Implement Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
- Define default permissions and roles
- Implement authorization middleware

## Tasks
1. Create RBAC schema migration (4h)
2. Implement RBAC Rust models and service (6h)
3. Implement authorization middleware (4h)

## New Tables
- `permissions` - All possible permissions
- `roles` - Role templates (owner, admin, member, viewer)
- `role_permissions` - Role-permission mapping
- `user_permissions` - Direct user permissions

## Default Roles
- org:owner - Full access
- org:admin - Manage members and settings
- org:member - Standard access
- org:viewer - Read-only access
- team:lead - Manage team members
- team:member - Team access

## Permissions Categories
- repositories (read, write, delete, connect)
- agents (read, execute, stop)
- workflows (read, create, update, delete, execute)
- organization (read, update, delete, members.*)
- teams (read, create, update, delete, members.*)
- billing (read, manage)

## Success Criteria
- [ ] RBAC schema migration applied
- [ ] 27 default permissions inserted
- [ ] 6 default roles inserted
- [ ] RBAC service implemented
- [ ] Authorization middleware working

**Detailed Plan**: `/tmp/phase1-database-foundation-detailed-plan.md` (Section 1.4)

- âŒ PyO3: ã‚³ãƒ³ãƒ‘ã‚¤ãƒ«è¤‡é›‘åŒ–ã€Pythonç’°å¢ƒä¾å­˜
- âŒ HTTP API: ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒãƒ¼ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ‰å¤§ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¤è¤‡é›‘
- âœ… Subprocess: ã‚·ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ«ã§ååˆ†

### Implementation

\`\`\`rust
// crates/miyabi-aws-agent/src/agent.rs
pub async fn run_python_cli(
    &self,
    subcommand: &str,
    args: &[&str]
) -> Result<String> {
    let mut cmd = Command::new("python3");
    cmd.arg("-m")
        .arg("aws_miyabi_agent.cli")
        .arg(subcommand)
        .args(args)
        .current_dir(&self.python_service_path)
        .stdout(Stdio::piped())
        .stderr(Stdio::piped());

    // Execute with timeout
    let output = tokio::time::timeout(
        Duration::from_secs(120),
        cmd.output()
    ).await??;

    // Handle errors
    if !output.status.success() {
        let stderr = String::from_utf8_lossy(&output.stderr);
        return Err(AwsAgentError::PythonExecutionError(
            stderr.to_string()
        ));
    }

    Ok(String::from_utf8_lossy(&output.stdout).to_string())
}
\`\`\`

### Error Handling

**Error Types**:
\`\`\`rust
#[derive(Debug, Error)]
pub enum AwsAgentError {
    #[error("Python service not found: {0}")]
    ServiceNotFound(String),

    #[error("Python execution error: {0}")]
    PythonExecutionError(String),

    #[error("Timeout after {0}s")]
    Timeout(u64),

    #[error("AWS credentials not configured")]
    CredentialsNotConfigured,
}
\`\`\`

### Retry Strategy

**Configuration**:
- Max retries: 3
- Backoff: Exponential (1s, 2s, 4s)
- Retry on: Network errors, timeout
- No retry on: Validation errors, auth errors

\`\`\`rust
async fn execute_with_retry<F, T>(
    operation: F,
    max_retries: u32
) -> Result<T>
where
    F: Fn() -> Future<Output = Result<T>>
{
    let mut retries = 0;
    loop {
        match operation().await {
            Ok(result) => return Ok(result),
            Err(e) if should_retry(&e) && retries < max_retries => {
                retries += 1;
                let delay = Duration::from_secs(2_u64.pow(retries - 1));
                tokio::time::sleep(delay).await;
            },
            Err(e) => return Err(e),
        }
    }
}
\`\`\`

### Performance Considerations

- **Startup Overhead**: ~200ms (Python interpreter startup)
- **Mitigation**: Batch multiple operations if possible
- **Caching**: Consider keeping Python process alive for repeated calls

\`\`\`

title: ðŸ§ª [Miyabi Console] Comprehensive Testing Suite
body:
# ðŸ§ª Comprehensive Testing Suite

## ðŸ“‹ Overview

Implement comprehensive testing for Miyabi Console including unit tests, integration tests, and E2E tests to ensure code quality and reliability.

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

- Achieve 80%+ code coverage
- Prevent regressions
- Ensure reliable deployments
- Document component behavior
- Enable confident refactoring

## ðŸ“¦ Scope

### Test Types

#### 1. Unit Tests (Jest + React Testing Library)
- Component rendering tests
- User interaction tests
- Hook tests
- Utility function tests

#### 2. Integration Tests
- API client tests
- WebSocket integration
- State management
- Route navigation

#### 3. E2E Tests (Playwright)
- Critical user flows
- Multi-page workflows
- Real browser testing

## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: Test Infrastructure Setup (1h)
- [ ] Install testing dependencies
  - `@testing-library/react`
  - `@testing-library/jest-dom`
  - `@testing-library/user-event`
  - `vitest`
  - `@playwright/test`
- [ ] Configure Vitest
- [ ] Configure Playwright
- [ ] Setup test utilities
- [ ] Create mock providers

### Phase 2: Component Unit Tests (2h)
- [ ] Dashboard Page tests
- [ ] Agents Page tests
- [ ] Database Page tests
- [ ] Settings Page tests
- [ ] Layout component tests
- [ ] Card components tests
- [ ] Modal components tests

### Phase 3: Integration Tests (1h)
- [ ] API client tests
- [ ] WebSocket connection tests
- [ ] Router integration tests
- [ ] State management tests

### Phase 4: E2E Tests (1h)
- [ ] Login flow (if auth implemented)
- [ ] Dashboard â†’ Agents navigation
- [ ] Agent start/stop workflow
- [ ] Database query execution
- [ ] Settings save/reset

### Phase 5: Coverage & CI Integration (30m)
- [ ] Setup coverage reporting
- [ ] Add GitHub Actions workflow
- [ ] Configure pre-commit hooks
- [ ] Add coverage badges

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

### Coverage Targets
- [ ] Overall coverage: 80%+
- [ ] Component coverage: 85%+
- [ ] Utility function coverage: 90%+
- [ ] Critical paths coverage: 100%

### Test Quality
- [ ] All tests pass consistently
- [ ] No flaky tests
- [ ] Tests run in < 30s
- [ ] E2E tests complete in < 2min
- [ ] Clear test descriptions
- [ ] No test warnings or errors

### CI/CD Integration
- [ ] Tests run on every PR
- [ ] Coverage report posted to PR
- [ ] Blocks merge if tests fail
- [ ] Runs on push to main

## ðŸ“Š Estimated Time

**Total**: 4-5 hours
- Infrastructure: 1h
- Unit Tests: 2h
- Integration Tests: 1h
- E2E Tests: 1h
- CI Setup: 30m

## ðŸ”— Test Structure

```
miyabi-console/
â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ __tests__/
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ Layout.test.tsx
â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ AgentCard.test.tsx
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pages/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ __tests__/
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ DashboardPage.test.tsx
â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ AgentsPage.test.tsx
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ lib/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ __tests__/
â”‚           â””â”€â”€ api.test.ts
â”œâ”€â”€ tests/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ integration/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api.test.ts
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ websocket.test.ts
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ e2e/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ critical-flows.spec.ts
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ navigation.spec.ts
â””â”€â”€ vitest.config.ts
```

## ðŸ“ Example Tests

### Unit Test Example
```typescript
describe('AgentCard', () => {
  it('displays agent name and status', () => {
    const agent = { id: '1', name: 'CodeGen', status: 'active' }
    render(<AgentCard agent={agent} />)
    
    expect(screen.getByText('CodeGen')).toBeInTheDocument()
    expect(screen.getByText('active')).toBeInTheDocument()
  })

  it('calls onClick when card is clicked', () => {
    const onClick = vi.fn()
    const agent = { id: '1', name: 'CodeGen', status: 'active' }
    render(<AgentCard agent={agent} onClick={onClick} />)
    
    fireEvent.click(screen.getByRole('button'))
    expect(onClick).toHaveBeenCalledWith(agent)
  })
})
```

### E2E Test Example
```typescript
test('agent start/stop workflow', async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/agents')
  
  // Find an idle agent
  const agent = page.locator('[data-testid="agent-card"]').first()
  await agent.click()
  
  // Start the agent
  await page.locator('button:has-text("Start")').click()
  await expect(page.locator('.status-chip')).toHaveText('active')
  
  // Stop the agent
  await page.locator('button:has-text("Stop")').click()
  await expect(page.locator('.status-chip')).toHaveText('idle')
})
```

## ðŸŽ¯ Benefits

- **Reliability**: Catch bugs before production
- **Confidence**: Safe refactoring
- **Documentation**: Tests as living documentation
- **Quality**: Maintain code quality standards
- **CI/CD**: Automated quality gates

title: ðŸ”„ [Miyabi Console] WebSocket Real-time Updates
body:
# ðŸ”„ WebSocket Real-time Updates

## ðŸ“‹ Overview

Implement WebSocket connections for real-time updates across Miyabi Console, eliminating the need for polling and providing instant feedback to users.

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

- Establish WebSocket connection to backend
- Real-time Agent status updates
- Live deployment progress tracking
- Instant error notifications
- Connection status indicator

## ðŸ“¦ Scope

### WebSocket Events

#### Agent Events
- `agent:status_changed` - Agent state transitions
- `agent:task_started` - Task execution started
- `agent:task_completed` - Task execution completed
- `agent:error` - Agent error occurred

#### Deployment Events
- `deployment:started` - Deployment initiated
- `deployment:progress` - Deployment progress update
- `deployment:completed` - Deployment finished
- `deployment:failed` - Deployment failed

#### System Events
- `system:metrics_updated` - System metrics update
- `system:alert` - System-wide alert
- `database:query_completed` - Query execution finished

## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Plan

### Phase 1: WebSocket Client Setup (1h)
- [ ] Install WebSocket library (`ws` or `socket.io-client`)
- [ ] Create WebSocket context provider
- [ ] Implement connection/reconnection logic
- [ ] Add connection status indicator
- [ ] Handle connection errors

### Phase 2: Dashboard Real-time Updates (30m)
- [ ] Subscribe to `system:metrics_updated`
- [ ] Update metrics in real-time
- [ ] Add activity feed real-time updates
- [ ] Display connection status

### Phase 3: Agents Page Real-time (30m)
- [ ] Subscribe to agent status events
- [ ] Update agent cards in real-time
- [ ] Remove polling mechanism
- [ ] Add "Live" indicator

### Phase 4: Deployment Page Real-time (30m)
- [ ] Subscribe to deployment events
- [ ] Live deployment progress bar
- [ ] Real-time log streaming
- [ ] Instant completion notifications

### Phase 5: Error Handling & Reconnection (30m)
- [ ] Implement exponential backoff
- [ ] Add offline mode
- [ ] Queue messages during disconnect
- [ ] Display reconnection attempts

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] WebSocket connection established on app load
- [ ] Agent status updates appear instantly (< 1s delay)
- [ ] Deployment progress updates in real-time
- [ ] Connection status visible in UI
- [ ] Automatic reconnection on disconnect
- [ ] Graceful degradation to polling if WS unavailable
- [ ] No memory leaks from event listeners
- [ ] Clean disconnection on page unload
- [ ] Error messages displayed for connection issues

## ðŸ“Š Estimated Time

**Total**: 2-3 hours
- WebSocket Setup: 1h
- Dashboard: 30m
- Agents: 30m
- Deployment: 30m
- Error Handling: 30m

## ðŸ”— Related

- WebSocket Server: Backend `miyabi-web-api` WebSocket endpoint
- Frontend Context: `miyabi-console/src/contexts/WebSocketContext.tsx` (new)
- Connection Indicator: `miyabi-console/src/components/ConnectionStatus.tsx` (new)

## ðŸ“ Technical Notes

### WebSocket URL
```
ws://localhost:8080/ws
```

### Message Format
```json
{
  "type": "agent:status_changed",
  "timestamp": "2025-11-18T08:00:00Z",
  "data": {
    "agentId": "CodeGenAgent",
    "oldStatus": "idle",
    "newStatus": "active"
  }
}
```

### Connection States
- ðŸŸ¢ **Connected** - Active WebSocket connection
- ðŸŸ¡ **Connecting** - Attempting to connect
- ðŸ”´ **Disconnected** - Connection lost, retrying
- âšª **Offline** - No connection, using cached data

## ðŸŽ¯ Benefits

- **Instant Updates**: No 5-second delay for status changes
- **Reduced Load**: Eliminates polling overhead
- **Better UX**: Real-time feedback feels more responsive
- **Server Efficiency**: Push updates only when needed

title: ðŸ”’ Day 7: SSL Setup, Documentation & Final Validation
body:
# ðŸ”’ Day 7: SSL Setup, Documentation & Final Validation

**Part of**: #1018 (M1 Infrastructure Blitz)
**Depends on**: #1024 (Day 6)
**Timeline**: Sunday, Nov 24, 2025
**Duration**: ~2-3 hours
**Owner**: MUGEN (SSL), Orchestrator (Docs), MAJIN (Validation)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives

1. Setup SSL certificate (optional for M1)
2. Create deployment documentation
3. Final validation testing
4. Security testing
5. Generate M1 completion report

---

## âœ… Tasks

### Task 1: SSL Certificate Setup (30 min) [OPTIONAL]

**Owner**: MUGEN

**Option A: Use ACM Certificate** (if custom domain):
```bash
# Request certificate
aws acm request-certificate \
  --domain-name api.miyabi.ai \
  --validation-method DNS \
  --region us-west-2

# Add DNS validation records to DNS provider

# Wait for validation (5-10 min)
aws acm describe-certificate \
  --certificate-arn <cert-arn> \
  --query 'Certificate.Status'
# Expected: "ISSUED"

# Update ALB HTTPS listener with certificate
terraform apply -var="ssl_certificate_arn=<cert-arn>"
```

**Option B: Skip SSL for M1** (use HTTP):
- Can add SSL later for M2/M3
- HTTP sufficient for private alpha

**Acceptance Criteria** (if doing SSL):
- [ ] Certificate issued
- [ ] HTTPS listener configured
- [ ] HTTP redirects to HTTPS
- [ ] Certificate auto-renewal enabled

---

### Task 2: Create Deployment Documentation (45 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

**Documents to Create**:

**2.1 Infrastructure Runbook** (`docs/INFRASTRUCTURE_RUNBOOK.md`):
- AWS resource inventory
- Architecture diagram
- Access credentials locations
- Common operations (restart service, view logs, etc.)

**2.2 API Documentation** (`docs/API_DOCUMENTATION.md`):
- All endpoints documented
- Authentication flow
- Request/response examples
- Error codes

**2.3 Troubleshooting Guide** (`docs/TROUBLESHOOTING.md`):
- Common issues and resolutions
- How to check ECS task status
- How to view CloudWatch logs
- How to rollback deployment

**2.4 Update README.md**:
- Production URLs
- Deployment status
- Quick start guide

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] 4 documents created/updated
- [ ] Clear, actionable instructions
- [ ] Code examples included
- [ ] All resources documented

---

### Task 3: Final Validation Testing (30 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**3.1 All API Endpoints**:
```bash
# Test script covering all 22 API routes
./scripts/test-all-endpoints.sh
```

**3.2 Load Testing**:
```bash
# Sustained load test
ab -n 10000 -c 50 http://${ALB_DNS}/health

# Spike test
ab -n 5000 -c 200 http://${ALB_DNS}/health
```

**3.3 Database Query Performance**:
- Check slow query log
- Verify indexes
- Monitor connection pool

**3.4 Redis Performance**:
- Check hit/miss ratio
- Verify cache eviction policy
- Monitor memory usage

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] All endpoints responding correctly
- [ ] Load test: >100 req/sec, <1% errors
- [ ] API latency p95 < 100ms
- [ ] Database performance acceptable
- [ ] Redis cache working

---

### Task 4: Security Testing (20 min)

**Owner**: MAJIN

**4.1 Dependency Scan**:
```bash
# Backend (Rust)
cd crates/miyabi-web-api
cargo audit

# Frontend (npm)
cd miyabi-console
npm audit
```

**4.2 OWASP Top 10 Tests**:
- [ ] SQL Injection (try malicious input)
- [ ] XSS (try script injection)
- [ ] Authentication bypass attempts
- [ ] CSRF protection
- [ ] Insecure direct object references

**4.3 Network Security**:
- [ ] Verify security groups (no open ports)
- [ ] Verify private subnets isolated
- [ ] Verify RDS/Redis not publicly accessible

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] No critical vulnerabilities
- [ ] All OWASP tests passed
- [ ] Network properly secured

---

### Task 5: Generate M1 Completion Report (30 min)

**Owner**: Orchestrator (Mac)

**Report**: `/tmp/miyabi-m1-completion-report.md`

**Contents**:
1. Executive Summary
   - M1 infrastructure 100% complete
   - All success criteria met

2. Deployed Resources
   - Full resource inventory with ARNs
   - Cost breakdown

3. Test Results
   - E2E test results
   - Performance benchmarks
   - Security scan results

4. Known Issues (if any)
   - P2/P3 bugs documented

5. Next Steps
   - Week 2: Testing & CI/CD
   - Week 3: User onboarding

6. Metrics
   - API uptime: 99%+
   - API latency p95: <100ms
   - Infrastructure cost: $200/month

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- [ ] Report complete
- [ ] All metrics documented
- [ ] Ready for Maestro review

---

## ðŸ“Š Day 7 Deliverables

- [x] SSL configured (optional)
- [x] Documentation complete (4 docs)
- [x] Final validation tests passing
- [x] Security tests passing
- [x] M1 Completion Report generated
- [x] All Day 1-7 issues closed
- [x] M1 Infrastructure Blitz COMPLETE

---

## ðŸŽ¯ M1 Success Criteria Checklist

title: [Pantheon Webapp] Implement Miyabi Integration Dashboard - Real-time Agent Activity
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/miyabi-integration`
**Access:** Authenticated
**Estimated Time:** 6-8 hours
**Project:** The Pantheon Project
**Tech Stack:** Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS
**URL:** https://d3ev2zsrbkwq8v.cloudfront.net

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create a live integration dashboard that shows real-time connections between The Pantheon advisors and the AWS Miyabi Agent system. Displays recent consultations, wisdom applied to real tasks, and performance metrics.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] Live agent status from Miyabi API
- [ ] Recent consultations feed
- [ ] Wisdom applied to real tasks
- [ ] Performance metrics dashboard
- [ ] Task-to-advisor mapping visualization
- [ ] Success rate by advisor
- [ ] Most consulted advisors ranking
- [ ] Real-time activity stream
- [ ] Filter by division
- [ ] Filter by time range

### Dashboard Sections

#### 1. System Status
- Miyabi agents online count
- Pantheon API status
- Total consultations today
- Average response time

#### 2. Recent Consultations
```
âœ… Task: Deploy Web API v1.1
   Advisor: Leonardo da Vinci
   Wisdom: "Simplicity is ultimate sophistication"
   Result: Deployment successful
   Time: 2h ago

ðŸ”„ Task: Resolve merge conflict
   Advisor: Sun Tzu
   Wisdom: "Avoid prolonged battles"
   Status: In progress
   Time: 30m ago
```

#### 3. Advisor Performance
- Consultation count by advisor
- Success rate percentage
- Average confidence score
- Most impactful wisdom quotes

#### 4. Division Analytics
- Consultations by division (pie chart)
- Division effectiveness over time
- Most active division

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure
- **Main Component:** `pantheon-webapp/app/miyabi-integration/page.tsx`
- **Sub-components:**
  - `SystemStatusCards.tsx` - System overview metrics
  - `RecentConsultationsFeed.tsx` - Live consultation feed
  - `AdvisorPerformanceChart.tsx` - Performance visualization
  - `DivisionAnalytics.tsx` - Division-level metrics
  - `ActivityStream.tsx` - Real-time activity log
  - `TaskWisdomMapping.tsx` - Task-advisor connections

### State Management
```typescript
interface IntegrationDashboardState {
  systemStatus: SystemStatus;
  consultations: MiyabiConsultation[];
  advisorMetrics: AdvisorMetrics[];
  divisionMetrics: DivisionMetrics[];
  activityStream: Activity[];
  filters: {
    division?: string;
    timeRange: '1h' | '24h' | '7d' | '30d';
  };
  isLoading: boolean;
}

interface MiyabiConsultation {
  id: string;
  task_id: string;
  task_title: string;
  advisor_id: string;
  advisor_name: string;
  wisdom: string;
  result: 'success' | 'in_progress' | 'failed';
  created_at: Date;
  completed_at?: Date;
}

interface AdvisorMetrics {
  advisor_id: string;
  advisor_name: string;
  consultation_count: number;
  success_rate: number;
  avg_confidence: number;
  top_wisdom: string;
}

interface SystemStatus {
  agents_online: number;
  api_status: 'healthy' | 'degraded' | 'down';
  consultations_today: number;
  avg_response_time: number;
}
```

### API Endpoints

#### Miyabi Backend Integration
- `GET /api/v1/miyabi/status` - System status
- `GET /api/v1/miyabi/consultations` - Recent consultations
- `GET /api/v1/miyabi/metrics/advisors` - Advisor performance
- `GET /api/v1/miyabi/metrics/divisions` - Division analytics
- `GET /api/v1/miyabi/activity` - Real-time activity stream
- WebSocket `/ws/miyabi/activity` - Live updates

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Dashboard displays real-time system status
- [ ] Recent consultations feed updates automatically
- [ ] Advisor performance charts display correctly
- [ ] Division analytics pie/bar charts work
- [ ] Activity stream shows live updates via WebSocket
- [ ] Time range filter works (1h, 24h, 7d, 30d)
- [ ] Division filter works
- [ ] Click consultation opens detail modal
- [ ] Click advisor navigates to advisor profile
- [ ] Success/failure indicators are color-coded
- [ ] Loading states for all sections
- [ ] Error handling for API failures
- [ ] Responsive design works on mobile
- [ ] Auto-refresh every 30 seconds
- [ ] Authentication required

## ðŸ“ Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Setup (1 hour)
- [ ] Create app/miyabi-integration/page.tsx
- [ ] Setup authentication check
- [ ] Create dashboard layout
- [ ] Setup WebSocket connection

### Phase 2: System Status (1 hour)
- [ ] Build SystemStatusCards component
- [ ] Fetch system status data
- [ ] Add real-time status indicators

### Phase 3: Consultations Feed (2 hours)
- [ ] Build RecentConsultationsFeed component
- [ ] Implement consultation cards
- [ ] Add detail modal
- [ ] Connect to API

### Phase 4: Analytics (2 hours)
- [ ] Build AdvisorPerformanceChart
- [ ] Implement DivisionAnalytics
- [ ] Add charts (Recharts)
- [ ] Connect to metrics API

### Phase 5: Activity Stream (1 hour)
- [ ] Build ActivityStream component
- [ ] Implement WebSocket integration
- [ ] Add live update animations

### Phase 6: Filters & Polish (1 hour)
- [ ] Add time range filter
- [ ] Add division filter
- [ ] Responsive design
- [ ] Loading states

### Phase 7: Testing (1 hour)
- [ ] Test real-time updates
- [ ] Test all filters
- [ ] Responsive testing
- [ ] Manual QA

## ðŸ“Š Metrics & Charts

### Chart Types
- **Line Chart:** Consultations over time
- **Pie Chart:** Consultations by division
- **Bar Chart:** Advisor performance ranking
- **Area Chart:** Success rate trend

### Data Visualization Libraries
- Recharts (recommended for Next.js)
- Chart.js
- Victory

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/pantheon-webapp-pages-plan.md`
- Miyabi Console: `miyabi-console/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx`
- Backend API: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/handlers/miyabi.rs`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

### Frontend
- Recharts for data visualization
- WebSocket client for real-time updates
- React Query for API calls

### Backend
- Miyabi consultation tracking system
- Metrics aggregation service
- WebSocket server for activity stream
- PostgreSQL for consultation history

## ðŸŽ¨ UI Design

### Color Coding
- **Success:** Green (#10B981)
- **In Progress:** Blue (#3B82F6)
- **Failed:** Red (#EF4444)
- **Warning:** Yellow (#F59E0B)

### Card Design
- Clean, minimal design
- Advisor portrait thumbnail
- Status badge (top-right)
- Timestamp (relative time)
- Wisdom quote (truncated)

## ðŸš€ Future Enhancements

- Consultation replay (step-by-step visualization)
- Advisor effectiveness heatmap
- Task success prediction based on advisor
- Wisdom impact scoring
- Export analytics report
- Notification when advisor is consulted
- Live video feed of agent activity (future)

```typescript
// Simple search
const searchAdvisors = (query: string, advisors: Agent[]) => {
  const lowerQuery = query.toLowerCase();
  return advisors.filter(advisor => 
    advisor.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowerQuery) ||
    advisor.nameJp.includes(lowerQuery) ||
    advisor.specialties.some(s => s.toLowerCase().includes(lowerQuery))
  );
};
```

title: [Pantheon Webapp] Implement About Page - Project Vision & Miyabi Integration
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/about`
**Access:** Public
**Estimated Time:** 3-4 hours
**Project:** The Pantheon Project

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure

  - `HeroSection.tsx` - Hero with project title
  - `VisionSection.tsx` - Project vision explanation

```
ðŸ›ï¸ The Pantheon Project

Where History's Greatest Minds Become Your AI Advisors

19 Legendary Figures | 6 Divisions | Infinite Wisdom
```

### Vision Section
- **What if** you could consult Sun Tzu for your business strategy?
- **What if** Leonardo da Vinci could advise on your product design?
- **What if** the greatest minds in history were available 24/7?

The Pantheon Project makes this possible by combining historical wisdom with cutting-edge AI technology.

### How It Works Section
1. **Select Your Challenge** - Describe your problem or decision
2. **Choose Advisors** - Pick from 19 legendary historical figures
3. **Receive Wisdom** - Get AI-powered insights based on their philosophies
4. **Make Decisions** - Apply synthesized recommendations to your situation

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/pantheon-webapp-pages-plan.md`
- Home Page: `pantheon-webapp/app/page.tsx`
- Agents Data: `pantheon-webapp/data/agents.json`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

- Tailwind CSS for styling
- Framer Motion for animations (optional)
- Next.js Image for optimized images
- React Icons for division icons

## ðŸŒ SEO Requirements

```typescript

  title: 'About | The Pantheon Project - AI Advisors from History',
```
