```typescript
    title: 'About The Pantheon Project',
    description: 'History\'s greatest minds as AI agent advisors',
    images: ['/og-about.png'],
  },
};
```

## ðŸš€ Future Enhancements

- Video introduction
- Interactive timeline of advisors
- Testimonials section
- FAQ section
- Newsletter signup

title: [Miyabi Console] Implement Organizations Page - Multi-Tenant Management
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/organizations`
**Priority:** P2 (Medium Priority)
**Estimated Time:** 6-8 hours
**Project:** Miyabi Console
**Tech Stack:** React 18, TypeScript, HeroUI, Tailwind, Vite

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create a multi-tenant organization management page that allows users to view, switch between, and manage organizations they belong to. Includes member management, role assignment, and organization settings.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] List all organizations the user belongs to
- [ ] Organization switcher (change context)
- [ ] Create new organization
- [ ] View organization details
- [ ] Invite members via email
- [ ] Manage member roles (owner, admin, member, viewer)
- [ ] Remove members from organization
- [ ] Organization settings (name, slug, plan tier)
- [ ] Leave organization
- [ ] Delete organization (owner only)
- [ ] View organization activity log

### Role Hierarchy
- **Owner** - Full control, can delete organization
- **Admin** - Manage members, settings (cannot delete org)
- **Member** - Use organization resources
- **Viewer** - Read-only access

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure
- **Main Component:** `miyabi-console/src/pages/OrganizationsPage.tsx`
- **Sub-components:**
  - `OrganizationList.tsx` - List of user's organizations
  - `OrganizationCard.tsx` - Individual organization card
  - `OrganizationSwitcher.tsx` - Dropdown to switch active org
  - `OrganizationDetails.tsx` - Organization information panel
  - `MemberList.tsx` - List of organization members
  - `MemberInviteModal.tsx` - Invite new members
  - `OrganizationSettingsModal.tsx` - Edit organization settings

### State Management
```typescript
interface OrganizationsPageState {
  organizations: Organization[];
  currentOrganization: Organization | null;
  members: OrganizationMember[];
  pendingInvites: Invitation[];
  isLoading: boolean;
  selectedOrg: Organization | null;
}

interface Organization {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  slug: string;
  owner_id: string;
  plan_tier: 'free' | 'pro' | 'enterprise';
  created_at: Date;
  member_count: number;
  role: 'owner' | 'admin' | 'member' | 'viewer';
}

interface OrganizationMember {
  id: string;
  user_id: string;
  email: string;
  full_name: string;
  role: 'owner' | 'admin' | 'member' | 'viewer';
  joined_at: Date;
}

interface Invitation {
  id: string;
  email: string;
  role: 'admin' | 'member' | 'viewer';
  invited_by: string;
  expires_at: Date;
}
```

### API Endpoints Required
- `GET /api/v1/organizations` - List user's organizations
- `GET /api/v1/organizations/:id` - Get organization details
- `POST /api/v1/organizations` - Create new organization
- `PATCH /api/v1/organizations/:id` - Update organization
- `DELETE /api/v1/organizations/:id` - Delete organization
- `GET /api/v1/organizations/:id/members` - Get members
- `POST /api/v1/organizations/:id/members` - Invite member
- `PATCH /api/v1/organizations/:id/members/:userId` - Update member role
- `DELETE /api/v1/organizations/:id/members/:userId` - Remove member
- `POST /api/v1/organizations/:id/leave` - Leave organization
- `GET /api/v1/organizations/:id/invitations` - List pending invitations
- `POST /api/v1/organizations/switch` - Switch active organization

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Page displays all organizations user belongs to
- [ ] Organization cards show name, role, member count, plan tier
- [ ] Clicking organization shows detailed view
- [ ] Organization switcher updates JWT context
- [ ] Invite member sends email invitation
- [ ] Role changes are reflected immediately
- [ ] Owners can delete organizations (with confirmation)
- [ ] Non-owners can leave organizations
- [ ] Settings can be updated by admins/owners
- [ ] Pending invitations are displayed
- [ ] Member list shows all members with roles
- [ ] Responsive design works on mobile
- [ ] Loading states are implemented
- [ ] Error handling for API failures
- [ ] Permission checks prevent unauthorized actions

## ðŸ“ Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Setup (1 hour)
- [ ] Create `OrganizationsPage.tsx` file
- [ ] Setup routing in `App.tsx`
- [ ] Create basic layout structure

### Phase 2: Organization List (2 hours)
- [ ] Implement `OrganizationList` component
- [ ] Create `OrganizationCard` component
- [ ] Add create organization functionality
- [ ] Implement organization switcher

### Phase 3: Member Management (2 hours)
- [ ] Build `MemberList` component
- [ ] Implement `MemberInviteModal` component
- [ ] Add role assignment functionality
- [ ] Create member removal logic

### Phase 4: Organization Settings (1-2 hours)
- [ ] Build `OrganizationSettingsModal` component
- [ ] Implement update functionality
- [ ] Add delete organization flow
- [ ] Create leave organization flow

### Phase 5: API Integration (1 hour)
- [ ] Create API client methods
- [ ] Implement real-time updates
- [ ] Add optimistic UI updates

### Phase 6: Styling & Polish (1 hour)
- [ ] Apply HeroUI components
- [ ] Responsive design
- [ ] Animations and transitions
- [ ] Loading skeletons

### Phase 7: Testing (1 hour)
- [ ] Unit tests for components
- [ ] Integration tests for API calls
- [ ] Permission testing
- [ ] Manual QA

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/miyabi-console-pages-plan.md`
- Auth Context: `miyabi-console/src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx`
- API Client: `miyabi-console/src/lib/api/client.ts`
- Database Schema: `crates/miyabi-web-api/migrations/20251117000001_add_multi_tenant_schema.sql`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

- **Backend:**
  - Multi-tenant organization schema (already implemented)
  - JWT token must include organization_id
  - Email service for invitations
  - Permission middleware

- **Frontend:**
  - Auth context must support organization switching
  - Token refresh when switching organizations

## ðŸ” Security Considerations

- Verify user permissions before showing admin/owner actions
- Prevent users from escalating their own role
- Require confirmation for destructive actions (delete, remove member)
- Validate email addresses for invitations
- Rate limit invitation sends

## ðŸš€ Future Enhancements

- Organization billing and subscription management
- Custom roles and permissions
- Organization branding (logo, colors)
- SSO integration
- Audit logs for organization changes
- Team management (sub-groups within org)

title: [Miyabi Console] Implement Workflows Page - Visual Workflow Automation Builder
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/workflows`
**Priority:** P2 (Medium Priority)
**Estimated Time:** 8-12 hours
**Project:** Miyabi Console
**Tech Stack:** React 18, TypeScript, HeroUI, Tailwind, Vite, React Flow

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create a visual workflow automation builder that allows users to create, configure, and manage automated workflows for the Miyabi agent system. Users can define triggers, actions, conditional logic, and schedules.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] Visual drag-and-drop workflow builder
- [ ] Node library (triggers, actions, conditions, delays)
- [ ] Trigger configuration (GitHub events, schedules, webhooks)
- [ ] Action sequencing with connectors
- [ ] Conditional logic (if/else branches)
- [ ] Schedule workflows (cron expressions)
- [ ] Test workflow execution
- [ ] Save and load workflows
- [ ] Workflow templates
- [ ] Execution history viewer

### Example Workflow

```
[GitHub PR Created] 
    â†“
[Run Tests] 
    â†“
[If Pass] â†’ [Deploy to Staging]
    â†“
[If Fail] â†’ [Notify Team]
```

### Node Types

#### Triggers
- GitHub PR Created/Updated
- Schedule (Cron)
- Webhook Received
- Manual Trigger
- Agent Status Change

#### Actions
- Run Tests
- Deploy Application
- Send Notification (Lark/Email)
- Create GitHub Issue
- Assign Task to Agent
- Execute Shell Command

#### Conditions
- If/Else
- Switch/Case
- Loop/Iterator

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure
- **Main Component:** `miyabi-console/src/pages/WorkflowsPage.tsx`
- **Sub-components:**
  - `WorkflowBuilder.tsx` - Main canvas with React Flow
  - `NodePalette.tsx` - Draggable node library
  - `NodeConfigPanel.tsx` - Configuration panel for selected node
  - `WorkflowList.tsx` - List of saved workflows
  - `WorkflowExecutionHistory.tsx` - Execution logs
  - `WorkflowTestRunner.tsx` - Test execution UI

### State Management
```typescript
interface WorkflowsPageState {
  workflows: Workflow[];
  currentWorkflow: Workflow | null;
  nodes: Node[];
  edges: Edge[];
  selectedNode: Node | null;
  isExecuting: boolean;
  executionLogs: ExecutionLog[];
}

interface Workflow {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  description: string;
  trigger: TriggerConfig;
  nodes: Node[];
  edges: Edge[];
  enabled: boolean;
  schedule?: CronExpression;
  lastRun?: Date;
}

interface Node {
  id: string;
  type: 'trigger' | 'action' | 'condition';
  data: NodeData;
  position: { x: number; y: number };
}
```

### API Endpoints Required
- `GET /api/v1/workflows` - List all workflows
- `GET /api/v1/workflows/:id` - Get workflow details
- `POST /api/v1/workflows` - Create new workflow
- `PATCH /api/v1/workflows/:id` - Update workflow
- `DELETE /api/v1/workflows/:id` - Delete workflow
- `POST /api/v1/workflows/:id/execute` - Trigger workflow execution
- `GET /api/v1/workflows/:id/executions` - Get execution history
- `POST /api/v1/workflows/:id/test` - Test workflow
- `PATCH /api/v1/workflows/:id/enable` - Enable/disable workflow

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Users can drag nodes from palette onto canvas
- [ ] Nodes can be connected with edges to create workflow
- [ ] Clicking a node opens configuration panel
- [ ] Each node type has appropriate configuration options
- [ ] Workflows can be saved and loaded
- [ ] Test execution shows step-by-step execution flow
- [ ] Execution history displays past runs with status
- [ ] Workflows can be enabled/disabled
- [ ] Schedule configuration supports cron expressions
- [ ] Error handling for invalid workflows
- [ ] Responsive layout (canvas adapts to screen size)
- [ ] Zoom and pan controls on canvas
- [ ] Undo/redo functionality

## ðŸ“ Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Setup (2 hours)
- [ ] Install React Flow library
- [ ] Create `WorkflowsPage.tsx` file
- [ ] Setup routing in `App.tsx`
- [ ] Create basic layout with sidebar and canvas

### Phase 2: Workflow Builder (4 hours)
- [ ] Implement `WorkflowBuilder` component with React Flow
- [ ] Create `NodePalette` with draggable nodes
- [ ] Implement node connection logic
- [ ] Add zoom/pan controls

### Phase 3: Node Configuration (2 hours)
- [ ] Build `NodeConfigPanel` component
- [ ] Implement configuration forms for each node type
- [ ] Add validation logic

### Phase 4: Workflow Management (2 hours)
- [ ] Implement `WorkflowList` component
- [ ] Add save/load functionality
- [ ] Create workflow templates

### Phase 5: Execution & Testing (2 hours)
- [ ] Build `WorkflowTestRunner` component
- [ ] Implement execution visualization
- [ ] Add `WorkflowExecutionHistory` component

### Phase 6: Styling & Polish (1-2 hours)
- [ ] Apply HeroUI styling
- [ ] Custom node styling
- [ ] Animations and transitions
- [ ] Loading states

### Phase 7: Testing (1 hour)
- [ ] Unit tests for workflow validation
- [ ] Integration tests for API calls
- [ ] Manual QA testing

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/miyabi-console-pages-plan.md`
- API Client: `miyabi-console/src/lib/api/client.ts`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

- **External Libraries:**
  - `react-flow-renderer` or `@xyflow/react` - Visual workflow builder
  - `cron-parser` - Cron expression validation
  - React Query for data fetching
  
- **Backend:**
  - Workflow execution engine must be implemented
  - Webhook receiver for triggers
  - Scheduler service for cron triggers

## ðŸŽ¨ Design Inspiration

- GitHub Actions workflow editor
- Zapier workflow builder
- n8n workflow automation

## ðŸš€ Future Enhancements

- Workflow versioning
- Collaborative editing
- Workflow marketplace/sharing
- Advanced debugging tools
- Performance metrics per workflow

title: âœ¨ [Miyabi Console] New Feature Pages
body:
# âœ¨ New Feature Pages

## ðŸ“‹ Overview

Implement additional feature pages to extend Miyabi Console functionality and provide comprehensive management capabilities.

## ðŸŽ¯ Proposed Features

### 1. ðŸ“‹ Issue Management Page
**Priority**: High  
**Estimated Time**: 3-4 hours

#### Features
- List all GitHub Issues with filters
- Create new issues from console
- Update issue status
- Assign issues to agents
- Label management
- Issue details modal

#### Implementation
- `/issues` route
- GitHub API integration
- Drag-and-drop Kanban board (optional)
- Issue templates

---

### 2. ðŸ“Š Task Management & DAG Visualization
**Priority**: High  
**Estimated Time**: 4-5 hours

#### Features
- Visualize Task DAG (Directed Acyclic Graph)
- Interactive node graph
- Task dependencies display
- Task status tracking
- Critical path highlighting

#### Implementation
- `/tasks` route
- ReactFlow for DAG visualization
- Task detail panel
- Dependency editor

---

### 3. ðŸ“ˆ Advanced Analytics Dashboard
**Priority**: Medium  
**Estimated Time**: 3-4 hours

#### Features
- Custom date range selection
- Agent performance trends
- Task completion analytics
- Deployment frequency charts
- Error rate monitoring
- Downloadable reports

#### Implementation
- `/analytics` route
- Advanced Recharts usage
- CSV/PDF export
- Custom metrics builder

---

### 4. ðŸ“œ Log Viewer (LDD Logs)
**Priority**: Medium  
**Estimated Time**: 2-3 hours

#### Features
- Real-time log streaming
- Log level filtering (debug, info, warn, error)
- Search and highlight
- Download logs
- Log aggregation by agent/task

#### Implementation
- `/logs` route
- Virtual scrolling for performance
- WebSocket for real-time updates
- Log parsing and formatting

---

### 5. ðŸŒ³ Worktree Manager
**Priority**: Low  
**Estimated Time**: 2-3 hours

#### Features
- List active worktrees
- Create new worktree
- Delete worktree
- Worktree status
- Branch management

#### Implementation
- `/worktrees` route
- Git worktree API integration
- Status indicators
- Cleanup utilities

---

### 6. ðŸ”” Notification Center
**Priority**: Low  
**Estimated Time**: 2 hours

#### Features
- Notification history
- Read/unread status
- Notification filtering
- Clear all notifications
- Notification preferences

#### Implementation
- Notification dropdown in header
- `/notifications` page
- Local storage persistence
- WebSocket for real-time

---

## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Approach

### Phase-based Rollout

#### Phase 1: High Priority (7-9 hours)
1. Issue Management Page
2. Task Management & DAG Visualization

#### Phase 2: Medium Priority (5-7 hours)
3. Advanced Analytics Dashboard
4. Log Viewer

#### Phase 3: Low Priority (4-5 hours)
5. Worktree Manager
6. Notification Center

## âœ… General Acceptance Criteria

For each new page:
- [ ] Responsive design (mobile, tablet, desktop)
- [ ] Loading states implemented
- [ ] Error handling with user-friendly messages
- [ ] Consistent UI/UX with existing pages
- [ ] Navigation integration in Layout
- [ ] TypeScript strict mode compliance
- [ ] Build succeeds without errors
- [ ] Performance: loads in < 2s

## ðŸ“Š Overall Estimated Time

**Total**: 16-21 hours
- Phase 1: 7-9 hours
- Phase 2: 5-7 hours
- Phase 3: 4-5 hours

## ðŸ”— Technical Stack

- **Visualization**: ReactFlow, Recharts
- **State Management**: React Context / Zustand
- **Data Fetching**: Axios + React Query
- **Real-time**: WebSocket
- **Export**: jsPDF, xlsx

## ðŸ“ Detailed Specs

### Issue Management Page Example

```typescript
interface IssueListProps {
  filters: {
    state: 'open' | 'closed' | 'all'
    labels: string[]
    assignee?: string
    search: string
  }
}

// Features
- Filter by state, labels, assignee
- Search by title/body
- Sort by created, updated, comments
- Pagination (50 per page)
- Create issue modal
- Quick actions (close, label, assign)
```

### Task DAG Visualization

```typescript
interface TaskNode {
  id: string
  label: string
  status: 'pending' | 'in_progress' | 'completed' | 'failed'
  dependencies: string[]
}

// ReactFlow setup
const nodes: Node[] = tasks.map(task => ({
  id: task.id,
  type: 'custom',
  data: { task },
  position: calculatePosition(task)
}))

const edges: Edge[] = tasks.flatMap(task => 
  task.dependencies.map(dep => ({
    id: `${dep}-${task.id}`,
    source: dep,
    target: task.id,
    animated: task.status === 'in_progress'
  }))
)
```

## ðŸŽ¯ Benefits

### For Users
- **Centralized Management**: All operations in one place
- **Better Insights**: Advanced analytics and visualizations
- **Productivity**: Faster task and issue management
- **Transparency**: Real-time logs and notifications

### For Development
- **Dogfooding**: Use Miyabi to manage Miyabi development
- **Debugging**: Better observability with logs
- **Monitoring**: Track system health and performance

## ðŸ“‹ Prioritization

Implement in this order based on user value:

1. **Issue Management** â†’ Direct productivity boost
2. **Task DAG** â†’ Better understanding of workflows
3. **Analytics** â†’ Data-driven decisions
4. **Log Viewer** â†’ Debugging and monitoring
5. **Worktree Manager** â†’ Development convenience
6. **Notification Center** â†’ Nice-to-have UX improvement

## ðŸš€ Quick Wins

For rapid implementation, start with:
- Issue Management (most requested)
- Log Viewer (high utility for debugging)

These two provide immediate value with moderate effort.

title: ðŸš€ [Miyabi Console] Performance Optimization
body:
# ðŸš€ Performance Optimization ## ðŸ“‹ Overview Optimize Miyabi Console performance to reduce initial load time, improve runtime performance, and enhance user experience. ## ðŸŽ¯ Objectives - Reduce initial bundle size by 30%+ - Improve Time to Interactive (TTI) to < 2s - Implement code splitting - Add lazy loading for heavy components - Optimize chart rendering performance ## ðŸ“¦ Current Performance Baseline ### Bundle Size (Production Build) - Total: 1,340 KB (382 KB gzipped) - Main JS: 53 KB (18.59 KB gzipped) - Vendor JS: 1,230 KB (356.89 KB gzipped) âš ï¸ - CSS: 256 KB (29.85 KB gzipped) ### Performance Metrics - Initial Load: ~2s - Time to Interactive: ~2.5s - Chart Rendering: ~500ms ## ðŸ› ï¸ Implementation Plan ### Phase 1: Code Splitting (1h) - [ ] Implement React.lazy for route-based splitting - [ ] Split by page (Dashboard, Agents, Database, etc.) - [ ] Add Suspense boundaries with loading states - [ ] Configure Vite manual chunks **Expected Reduction**: 40-50% initial bundle ### Phase 2: Lazy Loading Components (30m) - [ ] Lazy load chart libraries (Recharts, ReactFlow) - [ ] Lazy load modal components - [ ] Lazy load Settings page - [ ] Add intersection observer for below-fold content **Expected Reduction**: Additional 20% on-demand loading ### Phase 3: Bundle Analysis & Optimization (30m) - [ ] Analyze bundle with `rollup-plugin-visualizer` - [ ] Remove duplicate dependencies - [ ] Replace heavy libraries with lighter alternatives - [ ] Tree-shake unused code **Target**: Vendor bundle < 800 KB ### Phase 4: Runtime Performance (30m) - [ ] Memoize expensive computations - [ ] Virtualize long lists (react-window) - [ ] Debounce search inputs - [ ] Optimize re-renders with React.memo - [ ] Use useMemo for data transformations ### Phase 5: Asset Optimization (30m) - [ ] Compress images - [ ] Enable HTTP/2 server push - [ ] Add service worker for caching - [ ] Implement resource hints (preload, prefetch) ## âœ… Acceptance Criteria ### Bundle Size Targets - [ ] Total bundle: < 900 KB (< 260 KB gzipped) - [ ] Initial load: < 300 KB (< 80 KB gzipped) - [ ] Vendor chunk: < 800 KB (< 240 KB gzipped) ### Performance Targets - [ ] Lighthouse Performance Score: 90+ - [ ] Time to Interactive: < 2s - [ ] First Contentful Paint: < 1s - [ ] Largest Contentful Paint: < 2.5s ### User Experience - [ ] No layout shift during load - [ ] Smooth chart animations (60fps) - [ ] Instant page transitions - [ ] Loading states for lazy components ## ðŸ“Š Estimated Time **Total**: 2-3 hours - Code Splitting: 1h - Lazy Loading: 30m - Bundle Analysis: 30m - Runtime: 30m - Assets: 30m ## ðŸ”— Optimization Techniques ### Code Splitting Example ```typescript // Before import DashboardPage from './pages/DashboardPage' // After const DashboardPage = lazy(() => import('./pages/DashboardPage')) function App() { return ( }> } /> ) } ``` ### Manual Chunks Configuration ```typescript // vite.config.ts export default { build: { rollupOptions: { output: { manualChunks: { 'vendor-react': ['react', 'react-dom', 'react-router-dom'], 'vendor-ui': ['@heroui/react'], 'vendor-charts': ['recharts', 'reactflow'], } } } } } ``` ### Virtual Scrolling ```typescript import { FixedSizeList } from 'react-window' {({ index, style }) => (
)} ``` ## ðŸ“ˆ Expected Improvements | Metric | Before | After | Improvement | |--------|--------|-------|-------------| | Bundle Size | 1,340 KB | ~900 KB | -33% | | Initial Load | 2.0s | 1.2s | -40% | | TTI | 2.5s | 1.5s | -40% | | Lighthouse | 75 | 90+ | +20% | ## ðŸŽ¯ Benefits - **Faster Load**: Users see content 40% faster - **Better SEO**: Improved Lighthouse scores - **Mobile Performance**: Better experience on slow networks - **Cost Savings**: Reduced bandwidth usage - **User Retention**: Better first impression

title: [Miyabi Console] Implement Notifications Page - Centralized Notification Center
body:
## ðŸ“‹ Overview

**Route:** `/notifications`
**Priority:** P3 (Low Priority - Nice to Have)
**Estimated Time:** 4-6 hours
**Project:** Miyabi Console
**Tech Stack:** React 18, TypeScript, HeroUI, Tailwind, Vite

## ðŸŽ¯ Purpose

Create a centralized notification center where users can view all system notifications, task assignments, alerts, and activity updates in one place. Includes filtering, marking as read/unread, and quick actions.

## âœ¨ Features

### Core Features
- [ ] Display all notifications in chronological order
- [ ] Mark as read/unread
- [ ] Mark all as read
- [ ] Delete notification
- [ ] Filter by type (task, alert, mention, system)
- [ ] Filter by status (read, unread)
- [ ] Search notifications
- [ ] Quick action buttons (go to task, view alert, etc.)
- [ ] Real-time notification updates via WebSocket
- [ ] Notification preferences (toggle notification types)
- [ ] Desktop notifications (browser permission)
- [ ] Notification count badge in header

### Notification Types

#### Task Notifications
- Task assigned to you
- Task completed
- Task deadline approaching
- Task blocked
- Task comment/mention

#### System Alerts
- Agent status changed
- System health warning
- Deployment completed/failed
- Backup completed

#### Mentions
- Mentioned in comment
- Mentioned in issue
- Mentioned in PR

#### Organization
- Invited to organization
- Member joined/left
- Role changed

## ðŸ”§ Technical Specifications

### Component Structure
- **Main Component:** `miyabi-console/src/pages/NotificationsPage.tsx`
- **Sub-components:**
  - `NotificationList.tsx` - List of notifications
  - `NotificationItem.tsx` - Individual notification card
  - `NotificationFilters.tsx` - Filter controls
  - `NotificationPreferences.tsx` - Settings for notification types
  - `NotificationBadge.tsx` - Unread count badge (in header)

### State Management
```typescript
interface NotificationsPageState {
  notifications: Notification[];
  unreadCount: number;
  filters: {
    type: NotificationType[];
    status: 'all' | 'read' | 'unread';
    searchQuery: string;
  };
  isLoading: boolean;
  page: number;
  hasMore: boolean;
}

interface Notification {
  id: string;
  type: NotificationType;
  title: string;
  message: string;
  is_read: boolean;
  created_at: Date;
  action_url?: string;
  action_text?: string;
  metadata?: Record<string, any>;
}

type NotificationType = 
  | 'task_assigned'
  | 'task_completed'
  | 'task_comment'
  | 'task_deadline'
  | 'agent_status'
  | 'system_alert'
  | 'mention'
  | 'organization_invite'
  | 'deployment'
  | 'backup';
```

### API Endpoints Required
- `GET /api/v1/notifications` - List notifications (paginated)
- `GET /api/v1/notifications/unread-count` - Get unread count
- `PATCH /api/v1/notifications/:id/read` - Mark as read
- `PATCH /api/v1/notifications/:id/unread` - Mark as unread
- `PATCH /api/v1/notifications/mark-all-read` - Mark all as read
- `DELETE /api/v1/notifications/:id` - Delete notification
- `GET /api/v1/notifications/preferences` - Get user preferences
- `PATCH /api/v1/notifications/preferences` - Update preferences
- WebSocket `/ws/notifications` - Real-time notifications

## âœ… Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Page displays all notifications in reverse chronological order
- [ ] Unread notifications are visually distinct
- [ ] Click notification marks it as read automatically
- [ ] Filter controls work correctly
- [ ] Search filters notifications by title/message
- [ ] Mark all as read updates all notifications
- [ ] Action buttons navigate to correct pages
- [ ] Real-time notifications appear without refresh
- [ ] Desktop notifications work (if permission granted)
- [ ] Preferences page allows toggling notification types
- [ ] Badge in header shows unread count
- [ ] Infinite scroll loads more notifications
- [ ] Responsive design works on mobile
- [ ] Loading states are implemented
- [ ] Empty state shown when no notifications

## ðŸ“ Implementation Steps

### Phase 1: Setup (1 hour)
- [ ] Create `NotificationsPage.tsx` file
- [ ] Setup routing in `App.tsx`
- [ ] Create basic layout structure
- [ ] Add notification badge to header

### Phase 2: Notification List (2 hours)
- [ ] Implement `NotificationList` component
- [ ] Create `NotificationItem` component
- [ ] Add infinite scroll/pagination
- [ ] Implement mark as read/unread

### Phase 3: Filters & Search (1 hour)
- [ ] Build `NotificationFilters` component
- [ ] Implement type filtering
- [ ] Add search functionality
- [ ] Create filter state management

### Phase 4: Real-time Updates (1 hour)
- [ ] Add WebSocket integration
- [ ] Implement real-time notification arrival
- [ ] Add desktop notification support
- [ ] Update badge count in real-time

### Phase 5: Preferences (1 hour)
- [ ] Build `NotificationPreferences` component
- [ ] Implement preference toggles
- [ ] Save preferences to backend

### Phase 6: Styling & Polish (1 hour)
- [ ] Apply HeroUI components
- [ ] Responsive design
- [ ] Animations for new notifications
- [ ] Loading skeletons

### Phase 7: Testing (1 hour)
- [ ] Unit tests for components
- [ ] Integration tests for API calls
- [ ] Test real-time updates
- [ ] Manual QA

## ðŸ”— Related Files

- Planning Document: `/tmp/miyabi-console-pages-plan.md`
- API Client: `miyabi-console/src/lib/api/client.ts`
- Header Component: `miyabi-console/src/components/layout/Header.tsx`

## ðŸ“Œ Dependencies

- **Backend:**
  - Notifications table in database
  - WebSocket server for real-time updates
  - Notification preference storage
  - Notification creation triggers (task events, alerts, etc.)

- **Frontend:**
  - WebSocket client library
  - Browser notification API
  - Intersection Observer for infinite scroll

## ðŸ”” Notification Icon Types

```tsx
const notificationIcons = {
  task_assigned: 'ðŸ“‹',
  task_completed: 'âœ…',
  task_comment: 'ðŸ’¬',
  task_deadline: 'â°',
  agent_status: 'ðŸ¤–',
  system_alert: 'âš ï¸',
  mention: 'ðŸ’­',
  organization_invite: 'ðŸ‘¥',
  deployment: 'ðŸš€',
  backup: 'ðŸ’¾',
};
```

## ðŸŽ¨ UI Design Notes

- Unread notifications have blue left border
- Read notifications are slightly faded
- New notifications slide in from top
- Action buttons are primary color
- Delete button is subtle (hover to show)

## ðŸš€ Future Enhancements

- Email digest (daily/weekly summary)
- Push notifications (mobile app)
- Notification snooze/remind later
- Notification grouping (similar notifications)
- Custom notification rules
- Notification sound customization

title: ðŸ¤– Phase 3.2: Automated Index Update Scripts
body:
## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Create scripts to automatically update indexes when Constitutional Framework or docs/ structure changes.

## ðŸ“‹ Tasks

### Script Development

- [ ] Create `scripts/update_indexes.py`
- [ ] Detect changes in `.claude/context/` directory
- [ ] Auto-update `docs/INDEX.md` cross-references
- [ ] Auto-update Obsidian vault links
- [ ] Regenerate cross-reference matrix

### Update Logic

```python
# Pseudo-code
def update_indexes():
    # 1. Scan .claude/context/ for changes
    context_changes = detect_context_changes()
    
    # 2. Update docs/INDEX.md
    update_docs_index(context_changes)
    
    # 3. Update Obsidian links
    update_obsidian_vault(context_changes)
    
    # 4. Regenerate cross-ref matrix
    regenerate_matrix()
    
    # 5. Create PR with changes
    create_pr("Auto-update indexes")
```

### Integration

- [ ] Hook into Git pre-commit
- [ ] GitHub Action on context/ changes
- [ ] Manual trigger via CLI
- [ ] Dry-run mode for testing

## ðŸŽ¯ Success Criteria

- âœ… Script working for all index types
- âœ… GitHub Action integrated
- âœ… No manual index updates needed
- âœ… Comprehensive test coverage

## ðŸ“Š Impact

**Priority**: P1 (High)
**Effort**: 6-8 hours
**Timeline**: Week 5-6
**Part of**: Documentation Optimization v1.1

title: Phase 2.5: AWS Lambda Deployment & CloudWatch Monitoring
body:
# Phase 2.5: AWS Lambda Deployment & CloudWatch Monitoring

**Duration**: 8-10 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical - Blocks Dashboard functionality)
**Dependencies**: #983-#986 complete
**Parent Issue**: #970, #977

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Deploy Rust API to AWS Lambda via API Gateway with CloudWatch monitoring.

## ðŸ“‹ Deployment Tasks

### Task 2.5.1: Lambda Runtime Setup (3h)

**Install cargo-lambda**:
```bash
cargo install cargo-lambda
cargo lambda --version
```

**Update Cargo.toml**:
```toml
[dependencies]
lambda_runtime = "0.8"
lambda_http = "0.8"
tokio = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }
```

**Create Lambda Binary**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/bin/lambda-api.rs`

**Build for Lambda**:
```bash
cd crates/miyabi-web-api
cargo lambda build --release --bin lambda-api
# Output: target/lambda/lambda-api/bootstrap.zip
```

---

### Task 2.5.2: Deploy to AWS Lambda (3h)

**Deploy Lambda Function**:
```bash
cargo lambda deploy \
  --binary-name lambda-api \
  --iam-role arn:aws:iam::112530848482:role/MiyabiLambdaExecutionRole \
  --region us-west-2 \
  --memory 512 \
  --timeout 30 \
  --env-file .env.production
```

**Set Environment Variables**:
```bash
aws lambda update-function-configuration \
  --function-name miyabi-api \
  --environment Variables="{
    DATABASE_URL=$DATABASE_URL,
    JWT_SECRET=$JWT_SECRET,
    GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=$GITHUB_CLIENT_ID,
    GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=$GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET
  }"
```

**Configure Provisioned Concurrency** (2 warm instances):
```bash
aws lambda put-provisioned-concurrency-config \
  --function-name miyabi-api \
  --provisioned-concurrent-executions 2 \
  --qualifier '$LATEST'
```

**Cost**: ~$10/month for 2 provisioned instances

---

### Task 2.5.3: Setup API Gateway (2h)

**Create HTTP API Gateway**:
```bash
aws apigatewayv2 create-api \
  --name miyabi-api \
  --protocol-type HTTP \
  --target arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:112530848482:function:miyabi-api

API_ID=$(aws apigatewayv2 get-apis --query "Items[?Name=='miyabi-api'].ApiId" --output text)
echo "API Gateway URL: https://$API_ID.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com"
```

**Configure CORS**:
```bash
aws apigatewayv2 update-api \
  --api-id $API_ID \
  --cors-configuration AllowOrigins="*",AllowMethods="*",AllowHeaders="*"
```

**Create default stage**:
```bash
aws apigatewayv2 create-stage \
  --api-id $API_ID \
  --stage-name '$default' \
  --auto-deploy
```

**Update CloudFront Dashboard**:
```javascript
// Update pantheon-webapp/public/js/app.js
const API_BASE = 'https://YOUR_API_ID.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/api/v1';
```

---

### Task 2.5.4: Configure CloudWatch Monitoring (2h)

**Enable CloudWatch Logs** (automatic for Lambda)

**Create Log Insights Queries**:
```bash
# Query for errors
aws logs put-query-definition \
  --name "Miyabi API Errors" \
  --log-group-names "/aws/lambda/miyabi-api" \
  --query-string 'fields @timestamp, @message | filter @message like /ERROR/ | sort @timestamp desc | limit 100'

# Query for latency
aws logs put-query-definition \
  --name "Miyabi API Latency" \
  --log-group-names "/aws/lambda/miyabi-api" \
  --query-string 'fields @timestamp, @duration | stats avg(@duration), max(@duration), pct(@duration, 95) by bin(5m)'
```

**Create CloudWatch Alarms**:
```bash
# Alarm for high error rate (>5%)
aws cloudwatch put-metric-alarm \
  --alarm-name miyabi-api-high-error-rate \
  --metric-name Errors \
  --namespace AWS/Lambda \
  --statistic Average \
  --period 300 \
  --threshold 0.05 \
  --comparison-operator GreaterThanThreshold

# Alarm for high latency (>1s p95)
aws cloudwatch put-metric-alarm \
  --alarm-name miyabi-api-high-latency \
  --metric-name Duration \
  --namespace AWS/Lambda \
  --statistic Average \
  --period 300 \
  --threshold 1000 \
  --comparison-operator GreaterThanThreshold
```

---

## âœ… Deliverables

- [ ] cargo-lambda installed and configured
- [ ] Lambda binary built successfully
- [ ] Lambda function deployed to AWS
- [ ] Environment variables configured
- [ ] Provisioned concurrency set (2 instances)
- [ ] API Gateway created and configured
- [ ] CORS configured correctly
- [ ] CloudFront dashboard updated with API URL
- [ ] CloudWatch Logs configured
- [ ] Log Insights queries created
- [ ] CloudWatch Alarms set up
- [ ] Monitoring dashboard created
- [ ] End-to-end testing complete

---

## ðŸ“Š Success Criteria (from #970)

### Performance Requirements
- [ ] API response time < 200ms (p95)
- [ ] Lambda cold start < 1s
- [ ] WebSocket latency < 100ms
- [ ] Concurrent users: 100+ without degradation

### Integration Requirements
- [ ] GitHub OAuth flow complete
- [ ] JWT token refresh working
- [ ] CORS configured correctly
- [ ] CloudWatch logs capturing all requests

---

## ðŸš¨ Risk Mitigation

**Lambda Cold Start**:
- Provisioned concurrency (2 warm instances)
- Keep Lambda size <50MB
- Optimize dependencies

**PostgreSQL Connection Pool**:
- Lambda reuses connections via PgPool
- Set max_connections=20 per Lambda
- Monitor connection count in RDS

**Cost**: ~$58/month total
- RDS: $48/month
- Lambda provisioned concurrency: $10/month

---

## ðŸ§ª Testing

**Test API Gateway**:
```bash
# Health check
curl https://$API_ID.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/api/v1/health

# Dashboard API
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $JWT_TOKEN" \
  https://$API_ID.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/api/v1/dashboard/summary
```

**Load Testing**:
```bash
wrk -t 10 -c 100 -d 30s https://$API_ID.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/api/v1/health
```

---

**Parent Issues**: #970, #977
**Previous Issues**: #983-#986
**Blocks**: Phase 3 (Frontend Integration)

title: Phase 2.3: Worker & Coordinator Status APIs
body:
# Phase 2.3: Worker & Coordinator Status APIs

**Duration**: 4-6 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)
**Dependencies**: #978 (Service Layer), #984 (Task API) complete
**Parent Issue**: #970, #977

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Implement APIs for real-time worker and coordinator status monitoring.

## ðŸ“‹ API Endpoints to Implement

### GET /api/v1/workers
Get all workers status

**Response**:
```json
[
  {
    "worker_id": "Worker-1",
    "name": "Worker-1",
    "status": "busy",
    "current_task": {
      "task_id": "uuid",
      "title": "Task title",
      "started_at": "2025-11-17T10:00:00Z",
      "progress": 0.65
    },
    "cpu_usage": 45.2,
    "memory_usage": 62.8,
    "tasks_completed": 142,
    "tasks_failed": 8,
    "uptime_seconds": 86400,
    "last_heartbeat": "2025-11-17T15:30:00Z"
  }
]
```

---

### GET /api/v1/workers/{worker_id}
Get specific worker status

**Response**: Same as above (single object)

---

### GET /api/v1/coordinators
Get all coordinators status

**Response**:
```json
[
  {
    "coordinator_id": "mugen",
    "name": "MUGEN (EC2 US West)",
    "host": "44.250.27.197",
    "port": 22,
    "status": "online",
    "workers_managed": ["Worker-1", "Worker-2"],
    "active_tasks": 2,
    "total_capacity": 10,
    "cpu_usage": 45.2,
    "memory_usage": 62.8,
    "disk_usage": 35.0,
    "network_latency_ms": 25.5,
    "last_heartbeat": "2025-11-17T15:30:00Z"
  }
]
```

---

### GET /api/v1/coordinators/{coordinator_id}
Get specific coordinator status

**Valid coordinator IDs**: `mugen`, `majin`, `pixel-termux`

**Response**: Same as above (single object)

---

## ðŸ”§ Implementation Tasks

### Task 2.3.1: Implement Worker Status Routes (2h)

**File**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/routes/workers.rs` (NEW)

- `get_workers()` - List all workers
- `get_worker(worker_id)` - Get specific worker
- Integrate with WorkerService from #978
- Add OpenAPI documentation

---

### Task 2.3.2: Implement Coordinator Status Routes (2h)

**File**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/routes/coordinators.rs` (NEW)

- `get_coordinators()` - List all coordinators
- `get_coordinator(coordinator_id)` - Get specific coordinator
- Integrate with CoordinatorService from #978
- Add OpenAPI documentation

---

### Task 2.3.3: Register Routes in lib.rs (1h)

```rust
.route("/workers", get(routes::workers::get_workers))
.route("/workers/:worker_id", get(routes::workers::get_worker))
.route("/coordinators", get(routes::coordinators::get_coordinators))
.route("/coordinators/:coordinator_id", get(routes::coordinators::get_coordinator))
```

---

### Task 2.3.4: Event Broadcasting for Status Updates (1h)

**Periodic status broadcast** (every 10 seconds):
- `broadcast_worker_status(worker)`
- `broadcast_coordinator_status(coordinator)`

**WebSocket clients receive real-time status updates**

---

## âœ… Deliverables

- [ ] Worker status API (2 endpoints) implemented
- [ ] Coordinator status API (2 endpoints) implemented
- [ ] OpenAPI documentation complete
- [ ] Routes registered in lib.rs
- [ ] Event broadcasting working
- [ ] Real-time status updates via WebSocket
- [ ] API tested with curl

---

**Previous Issues**: #983, #984
**Next Issue**: #985

# Phase 2.2: Task Management API Implementation

**Duration**: 8-10 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)
**Dependencies**: #978 (Service Layer) complete
**Parent Issue**: #970, #977

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Implement RESTful API for task submission, tracking, and management.

## ðŸ“‹ API Endpoints to Implement

### POST /api/v1/tasks
Create a new task

**Request Body**:
```json
{
  "title": "Implement feature X",
  "description": "Detailed description",
  "task_type": "agent_execution",
  "priority": 1,
  "assigned_to": "Worker-1",
  "repository_id": "uuid",
  "issue_number": 123,
  "metadata": {}
}
```

**Response**: 201 Created + Task object

---

### GET /api/v1/tasks
List tasks with filtering

**Query Parameters**:
- `status`: Filter by status (pending, running, completed, failed, cancelled)
- `assigned_to`: Filter by worker ID
- `priority`: Filter by priority (0=P0, 1=P1, 2=P2)
- `limit`: Limit results (default: 50)
- `offset`: Pagination offset (default: 0)

**Response**: 200 OK + Array of Task objects

---

### GET /api/v1/tasks/{task_id}
Get task details by ID

**Response**: 200 OK + Task object

---

### PATCH /api/v1/tasks/{task_id}
Update task status or metadata

**Request Body**:
```json
{
  "status": "completed",
  "metadata": {}
}
```

**Response**: 200 OK + Updated Task object

---

### DELETE /api/v1/tasks/{task_id}
Delete task

**Response**: 204 No Content

---

## ðŸ”§ Implementation Tasks

### Task 2.2.1: Create Task Routes (4h)

**File**: `crates/miyabi-web-api/src/routes/tasks.rs`

- Implement all 5 route handlers
- Add OpenAPI documentation with `#[utoipa::path]`
- Integrate with TaskService from #978
- Add input validation
- Add error handling

---

### Task 2.2.2: Register Routes in lib.rs (1h)

**Uncomment routes**:
```rust
.route("/tasks", post(routes::tasks::create_task))
.route("/tasks", get(routes::tasks::list_tasks))
.route("/tasks/:task_id", get(routes::tasks::get_task))
.route("/tasks/:task_id", patch(routes::tasks::update_task))
.route("/tasks/:task_id", delete(routes::tasks::delete_task))
```

---

### Task 2.2.3: Event Broadcasting Integration (2h)

**Integrate with EventBroadcaster**:
- `broadcast_task_created(task)` on POST
- `broadcast_task_updated(task)` on PATCH
- `broadcast_task_deleted(task_id)` on DELETE

**WebSocket clients receive real-time updates**

---

### Task 2.2.4: API Testing (2h)

**Test with curl**:
```bash
# Create task
curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/v1/tasks \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $JWT_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"title": "Test task", "task_type": "test", "priority": 2}'

# List tasks
curl http://localhost:8080/api/v1/tasks?status=pending \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $JWT_TOKEN"

# Update task
curl -X PATCH http://localhost:8080/api/v1/tasks/$TASK_ID \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $JWT_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"status": "completed"}'
```

**Integration tests**: Write test cases for all endpoints

---

## âœ… Deliverables

- [ ] All 5 task API endpoints implemented
- [ ] OpenAPI documentation complete
- [ ] Routes registered in lib.rs
- [ ] Event broadcasting working
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] API tested with curl/Postman
- [ ] WebSocket real-time updates verified

---

**Parent Issues**: #970, #977
**Previous Issue**: #978
**Next Issue**: #980

title: Phase 2.1: Service Layer Refactoring
body:
# Phase 2.1: Service Layer Refactoring

**Duration**: 10-12 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)
**Dependencies**: Phase 1 complete
**Parent Issue**: #970, #977

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Separate business logic from HTTP handlers by creating a clean service layer architecture.

## ðŸ“‹ Tasks

### Task 2.1.1: Create Service Layer Structure (2h)

**Files to Create**:
```
crates/miyabi-web-api/src/services/
â”œâ”€â”€ mod.rs (service traits + exports)
â”œâ”€â”€ task_service.rs
â”œâ”€â”€ worker_service.rs
â”œâ”€â”€ coordinator_service.rs
â”œâ”€â”€ dashboard_service.rs
â”œâ”€â”€ repository_service.rs
â””â”€â”€ workflow_service.rs
```

**Service Trait Pattern**:
```rust
pub trait TaskService: Send + Sync {
    async fn create_task(&self, req: CreateTaskRequest) -> Result<Task>;
    async fn get_task(&self, task_id: Uuid) -> Result<Task>;
    async fn list_tasks(&self, filter: TaskFilter) -> Result<Vec<Task>>;
    async fn update_task_status(&self, task_id: Uuid, status: TaskStatus) -> Result<Task>;
    async fn delete_task(&self, task_id: Uuid) -> Result<()>;
}
```

---

### Task 2.1.2: Implement Task Service (4h)

**Database Schema** (to be added in Phase 1.3):
```sql
CREATE TABLE tasks (
    id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(),
    title VARCHAR(500) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    task_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
    priority INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 2,
    assigned_to VARCHAR(100),
    repository_id UUID REFERENCES repositories(id),
    issue_number INTEGER,
    execution_id UUID REFERENCES agent_executions(id),
    metadata JSONB,
    started_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    completed_at TIMESTAMPTZ,
    created_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    updated_at TIMESTAMPTZ NOT NULL DEFAULT NOW(),
    created_by UUID REFERENCES users(id)
);
```

**Implementation**: Full code in Phase 2 plan document

---

### Task 2.1.3: Implement Worker Service (3h)

**Responsibilities**:
- Query worker status from tasks table
- Aggregate worker metrics (completed/failed tasks)
- Track worker heartbeat
- Return worker health status

---

### Task 2.1.4: Implement Coordinator Service (3h)

**Coordinators**:
- MUGEN (EC2 US West - 44.250.27.197)
- MAJIN (EC2 Tokyo - 54.92.67.11)
- Pixel Termux (Local - 192.168.3.9)

**Responsibilities**:
- Query coordinator status (SSH health check)
- Return coordinator metrics (CPU, memory, disk, network)
- List workers managed by each coordinator
- Track active tasks per coordinator

---

## âœ… Deliverables

- [ ] Service layer structure created
- [ ] All service traits defined
- [ ] TaskService fully implemented with tests
- [ ] WorkerService fully implemented with tests
- [ ] CoordinatorService fully implemented with tests
- [ ] Models updated (Task, WorkerStatus, CoordinatorStatus)
- [ ] Unit tests for all services (>80% coverage)

---

**Parent Issues**: #970, #977
**Next Issue**: #979

title: Phase 3.5: CloudFront Redeployment & E2E Testing
body:
# Phase 3.5: CloudFront Redeployment & E2E Testing

**Phase**: 3 - Frontend Integration & Deployment
**Duration**: 5-7 hours
**Priority**: P0 (Critical)
**Dependencies**: #978, #979, #980, #981 (All Phase 3 tasks)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Deploy updated frontend to CloudFront and validate production readiness.

---

## ðŸ“‹ Part A: CloudFront Redeployment (2h)

### 1. Environment Configuration (15min)

- [ ] Set `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL` to API Gateway URL (from Phase 2)
- [ ] Verify all environment variables
- [ ] Test configuration locally

### 2. Production Build (15min)

- [ ] Clean previous build: `rm -rf .next/ out/`
- [ ] Run `npm run build`
- [ ] Verify static export succeeds
- [ ] Test build locally: `npx serve out`
- [ ] Check bundle size (<200KB first load)

### 3. S3 Upload (30min)

- [ ] Upload `out/` directory to S3 bucket
- [ ] Set proper cache headers
  - Static assets: `max-age=31536000, immutable`
  - HTML files: `max-age=0, must-revalidate`
- [ ] Verify all files uploaded successfully
- [ ] Check S3 bucket permissions

### 4. CloudFront Invalidation (30min)

- [ ] Create invalidation: `/*`
- [ ] Wait for invalidation (~5 min)
- [ ] Verify new version served
- [ ] Test production URL: https://d3ev2zsrbkwq8v.cloudfront.net

### 5. Smoke Testing (30min)

- [ ] Homepage loads correctly
- [ ] Dashboard shows real data
- [ ] Login flow works
- [ ] WebSocket connects
- [ ] API calls succeed
- [ ] Test on mobile device

---

## ðŸ“‹ Part B: E2E Testing Suite (3-4h)

### 1. Test Setup (1h)

- [ ] Install Playwright: `npm install -D @playwright/test`
- [ ] Create `playwright.config.ts`
- [ ] Configure test environment
- [ ] Create test fixtures and helpers

### 2. Critical Path Tests (2-3h)

**Authentication Tests**:
- [ ] Test: Login with GitHub
- [ ] Test: Logout
- [ ] Test: Protected route redirects to login
- [ ] Test: Session persistence

**Dashboard Tests**:
- [ ] Test: Dashboard loads data
- [ ] Test: Summary stats display correctly
- [ ] Test: Recent activity feed shows executions
- [ ] Test: Real-time updates work
- [ ] Test: Error handling

**Task Tests**:
- [ ] Test: Create new task
- [ ] Test: Task list displays
- [ ] Test: Task filtering
- [ ] Test: Task cancellation

**Mobile Tests**:
- [ ] Test: Responsive layout
- [ ] Test: Touch interactions
- [ ] Test: Mobile navigation

---

## ðŸ“‹ Part C: Performance & Accessibility (1h)

### Performance Testing (30min)

- [ ] Run Lighthouse audit (target: >90 all categories)
- [ ] Test Core Web Vitals
  - LCP: <2.5s
  - FID: <100ms
  - CLS: <0.1
- [ ] Check bundle size
- [ ] Verify image optimization

### Accessibility Testing (30min)

- [ ] Run axe-core accessibility scan
- [ ] Test keyboard navigation
- [ ] Test screen reader compatibility
- [ ] Verify ARIA labels
- [ ] Check color contrast

---

## ðŸ“ Deliverables

- [ ] Production deployment to CloudFront
- [ ] E2E test suite with 15+ tests
- [ ] Playwright configuration
- [ ] Performance report (Lighthouse)
- [ ] Accessibility audit report
- [ ] Test documentation
- [ ] Deployment runbook

---

## âœ… Success Criteria

**Deployment**:
- [ ] CloudFront serves new version
- [ ] All pages load correctly
- [ ] API calls work from production
- [ ] WebSocket connects successfully
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] Mobile view works

**Testing**:
- [ ] All E2E tests pass
- [ ] Lighthouse Performance: >90
- [ ] Lighthouse Accessibility: 100
- [ ] Core Web Vitals meet thresholds
- [ ] No critical bugs found

---

## ðŸš¨ Rollback Plan

If critical issues found:

1. **Immediate Rollback**:
   ```bash
   # Restore previous S3 version
   aws s3 sync s3://backup-bucket/ s3://live-bucket/ --delete
   
   # Invalidate CloudFront
   aws cloudfront create-invalidation --distribution-id ID --paths "/*"
   ```

2. **Document Issue**: Create P0 bug ticket
3. **Fix and Redeploy**: Fix locally, test, redeploy

---

## ðŸ“ Test Examples

```typescript
// tests/e2e/dashboard.spec.ts
import { test, expect } from '@playwright/test';

test('dashboard loads real data', async ({ page }) => {
  await page.goto('/dashboard');
  
  // Wait for API data to load
  await page.waitForSelector('[data-testid="dashboard-summary"]');
  
  // Verify data is not mock data
  const totalExecutions = await page.textContent('[data-testid="total-executions"]');
  expect(totalExecutions).not.toBe('1,234'); // not mock data
  
  // Verify real-time indicator
  await expect(page.locator('[data-testid="live-indicator"]')).toBeVisible();
});
```

---

## ðŸ“Š Performance Budget

- First Load JS: <150 KB
- Total Bundle: <500 KB
- LCP: <2.5 seconds
- FID: <100 milliseconds
- CLS: <0.1

---

**Related**: #977 #970 #978 #979 #980 #981  
**Created by**: Worker Agent 4

title: Phase 3.4: Authentication Flow Implementation
body:
# Phase 3.4: Authentication Flow Implementation

**Phase**: 3 - Frontend Integration & Deployment
**Duration**: 2-3 hours
**Priority**: P1 (High)
**Dependencies**: #978 (API Client)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Implement GitHub OAuth login flow with JWT token management.

---

## ðŸ“‹ Tasks

### 1. Login Page (1h)

- [ ] Create `app/login/page.tsx`
- [ ] Add "Login with GitHub" button
- [ ] Redirect to backend OAuth endpoint: `/api/v1/auth/github`
- [ ] Handle OAuth callback: `/api/v1/auth/github/callback`
- [ ] Extract JWT token from callback
- [ ] Redirect to dashboard on success

### 2. Auth Context (1-2h)

- [ ] Create `app/contexts/AuthContext.tsx`
- [ ] Store JWT token in memory (security best practice)
- [ ] Provide auth state to all components
- [ ] Implement logout functionality
- [ ] Add token refresh logic (before expiry)
- [ ] Handle token expiry gracefully

### 3. Protected Routes (30min)

- [ ] Create `app/components/ProtectedRoute.tsx`
- [ ] Wrap dashboard with auth check
- [ ] Redirect to login if not authenticated
- [ ] Show user profile in navbar
- [ ] Add logout button

---

## ðŸ“ File Changes

- [ ] `app/login/page.tsx` - Login page (NEW)
- [ ] `app/contexts/AuthContext.tsx` - Auth state (NEW)
- [ ] `app/components/ProtectedRoute.tsx` - Route guard (NEW)
- [ ] `app/components/UserProfile.tsx` - User info display (NEW)
- [ ] `app/layout.tsx` - Add auth provider (UPDATED)
- [ ] `app/dashboard/page.tsx` - Wrap with auth guard (UPDATED)

---

## ðŸ” Authentication Flow

```
1. User clicks "Login with GitHub"
2. Redirect to backend: /api/v1/auth/github
3. Backend redirects to GitHub OAuth
4. User authorizes app on GitHub
5. GitHub redirects to: /api/v1/auth/github/callback
6. Backend validates code, creates JWT
7. Backend redirects to frontend with token
8. Frontend stores token in AuthContext
9. Frontend redirects to dashboard
```

---

## ðŸŽ¨ UI Components

**Login Page**:
- Beautiful gradient background (match existing design)
- Large "Login with GitHub" button
- GitHub logo and branding
- Loading state during OAuth flow

**User Profile**:
- User avatar (from GitHub)
- Username
- Logout button
- Display in top-right navbar

---

## âœ… Success Criteria

- [ ] User can log in with GitHub
- [ ] Dashboard requires authentication
- [ ] JWT token stored securely (memory, not localStorage)
- [ ] Logout works properly
- [ ] Session persists on page reload (via token refresh)
- [ ] Token refresh works before expiry
- [ ] Expired token redirects to login
- [ ] User profile displays correctly

---

## ðŸš¨ Security Considerations

- Store token in memory (React state)
- Use httpOnly cookies if possible (backend decision)
- Never expose token in URL
- Implement CSRF protection
- Validate token on every API request
- Clear token on logout

---

**Related**: #977 #970 #978  
**Created by**: Worker Agent 4

# Phase 3.3: Real-Time WebSocket Integration

**Phase**: 3 - Frontend Integration & Deployment
**Duration**: 4-6 hours
**Priority**: P1 (High)
**Dependencies**: #978 (API Client), #979 (Dashboard UI)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Enable live updates without page refresh using WebSocket connection.

---

## ðŸ“‹ Tasks

### 1. WebSocket Client Setup (2h)

- [ ] Create `lib/websocket-client.ts`
- [ ] Implement WebSocket connection to backend
- [ ] Add auto-reconnect logic with exponential backoff
- [ ] Handle connection states (connecting, connected, disconnected, error)
- [ ] Add heartbeat/ping-pong mechanism
- [ ] Implement graceful connection closure

### 2. Real-Time Event Handlers (2-3h)

- [ ] Listen for `agent_execution_started` events
- [ ] Listen for `agent_execution_completed` events
- [ ] Listen for `agent_execution_failed` events
- [ ] Listen for `task_status_changed` events
- [ ] Update dashboard UI in real-time
- [ ] Show toast notifications for events
- [ ] Play sound alerts (optional, user preference)

### 3. Live Status Indicators (1h)

- [ ] Add "LIVE" badge when WebSocket connected
- [ ] Show connection status in navbar
- [ ] Display last update timestamp
- [ ] Add manual refresh button
- [ ] Show reconnecting status
- [ ] Implement fallback to polling if WebSocket unavailable

---

## ðŸ“ File Changes

- [ ] `lib/websocket-client.ts` - WebSocket client (NEW)
- [ ] `app/contexts/WebSocketContext.tsx` - React context (NEW)
- [ ] `app/components/LiveStatusIndicator.tsx` - Status badge (NEW)
- [ ] `app/dashboard/page.tsx` - Integrate WebSocket (UPDATED)
- [ ] `app/layout.tsx` - Add WebSocket provider (UPDATED)

---

## âœ… Success Criteria

- [ ] WebSocket connects successfully
- [ ] Dashboard updates in real-time
- [ ] Auto-reconnect works on disconnect
- [ ] Toast notifications show for events
- [ ] Connection status visible to user
- [ ] Graceful degradation to polling
- [ ] No memory leaks (connection cleanup)
- [ ] Works on mobile devices

---

## ðŸ”Œ WebSocket Events

**From Backend**:
```typescript
interface WebSocketEvent {
  type: 'agent_execution_started' | 'agent_execution_completed' | 'agent_execution_failed' | 'task_status_changed';
  payload: {
    execution_id: string;
    agent_type: string;
    status: string;
    repository: string;
    timestamp: string;
  };
}
```

**Connection URL**:
```
wss://xxxxxxxxxx.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/prod/ws
```

---

## ðŸš¨ Error Handling

- Network disconnection â†’ Show "Reconnecting..." status
- Connection timeout â†’ Retry with backoff
- Authentication error â†’ Redirect to login
- Server error â†’ Fallback to polling

---

**Related**: #977 #970 #978 #979  
**Created by**: Worker Agent 4

title: feat(orchestra): Phase 3 - 200-Agent Live Experiment & Production Readiness
body:
## ðŸŽ¯ Objective

Demonstrate Miyabi Orchestra 200-agent parallel execution capability and achieve production readiness for autonomous multi-agent operations.

## ðŸ“… Timeline

**Duration**: 3 weeks  
**Start**: 2025-11-18  
**Target Completion**: 2025-12-09

---

## ðŸ—ï¸ Phase Breakdown

### Phase 3.1: Infrastructure Setup (Week 1)

**Deliverables**:
- [ ] MUGEN server scaling (t3.medium â†’ c6i.4xlarge)
- [ ] MAJIN GPU server configuration  
- [ ] tmux session management (50+ parallel sessions)
- [ ] Real-time monitoring dashboard (5s polling)
- [ ] Redis/SQS async task queue setup
- [ ] CloudWatch metrics & alerting

**Success Criteria**:
- âœ… 50 agents can start simultaneously
- âœ… Dashboard operational with real-time metrics
- âœ… Automatic failover tested and working

**Estimated Cost**: $200-300 (EC2 for 1 week)

---

### Phase 3.2: 50-100 Agent Stress Test (Week 2)

**Test Scenarios**:

#### Test 1: Parallel Issue Processing (50 agents)
- Create 50 GitHub Issues via BatchIssueAgent
- Each agent handles 1 issue independently
- **Metrics**: Time to completion, success rate, resource usage

#### Test 2: Code Review Orchestra (100 agents)
- 10 PRs Ã— 10 review agents per PR
- Parallel review with conflict detection
- **Metrics**: Review quality, time, inter-agent conflicts

#### Test 3: Documentation Generation (75 agents)
- 75 crates in Cargo workspace
- Each agent generates README.md
- **Metrics**: Consistency, completeness, style adherence

**Performance Targets**:
- Agent spawn time: <30 seconds per agent
- Total execution time: <15 minutes (all tests)
- Error rate: <5%
- CPU utilization: >70% (efficient use)

---

### Phase 3.3: 200-Agent Grand Demonstration (Week 3)

**Scenario**: "Complete Product Development Sprint in 1 Hour"

**Task Distribution** (200 agents):
- **50 agents**: Issue analysis & sprint planning
- **80 agents**: Feature implementation (40 features Ã— 2 agents)
- **30 agents**: Test generation & execution
- **20 agents**: Documentation writing
- **10 agents**: Code review & PR creation
- **10 agents**: Integration & deployment preparation

**Success Metrics**:
- âœ… All 200 agents start within 5 minutes
- âœ… 95%+ task completion rate
- âœ… <5% error rate
- âœ… <$100 total cost
- âœ… Real-time dashboard operational throughout
- âœ… Zero manual intervention required

**Deliverables**:
- [ ] Screen recording (30-60 min video)
- [ ] Performance analysis report (PDF)
- [ ] Cost breakdown & optimization recommendations
- [ ] Demonstration blog post (note.com)

---

### Phase 3.4: Production Readiness & Documentation

**Post-Experiment Optimization**:
- [ ] Bottleneck analysis & resolution
- [ ] Agent spawn time optimization (<10s)
- [ ] Resource waste reduction (>20% improvement)
- [ ] Error handling & retry logic enhancement

**Documentation**:
- [ ] Orchestra Operations Manual
- [ ] Troubleshooting Guide
- [ ] API Reference (REST + CLI)
- [ ] Deployment Playbook (AWS/GCP/Azure)

**Integration**:
- [ ] Merge Phase 2 branches â†’ main
- [ ] Update CLAUDE.md v5.0
- [ ] Release announcement (note.com + Twitter)
- [ ] Demo video upload (YouTube)

---

## ðŸ“Š Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

| Metric | Target | Measurement |
|--------|--------|-------------|
| **Agent Spawn Time** | <10s | Time from request to active |
| **Completion Rate** | >95% | Successfully completed tasks / total |
| **Error Rate** | <5% | Failed tasks / total |
| **Resource Efficiency** | >70% CPU | Average CPU utilization |
| **Cost per Task** | <$0.50 | Total cost / tasks completed |
| **Parallel Efficiency** | >80% | Actual speedup / theoretical |

---

## ðŸ› ï¸ Technical Requirements

- **MUGEN**: c6i.4xlarge (16 vCPU, 32GB RAM)

title: ðŸ› Fix build script syntax error in scripts/build-line-bot.sh:25
body:
## Problem

Build script for LINE Bot Lambda fails with syntax error when executed from Pixel Termux.

```bash
scripts/build-line-bot.sh: line 25: unexpected EOF while looking for matching `"'
```

## Impact

- Cannot deploy LINE Bot Lambda directly from Pixel
- Requires workaround via MacBook SSH connection
- Documented in: `~/Obsidian/MIYABI/03-Issues/issue-line-bot-build-syntax-error.md`

## Root Cause

Missing closing quote in `scripts/build-line-bot.sh` at line 25.

## Workaround (Current)

```bash
ssh macbook "cd ~/Dev/01-miyabi/_core/miyabi-private/infrastructure/aws-cdk && \
  npx cdk deploy --app 'npx ts-node --prefer-ts-exts bin/miyabi-line-bot.ts' \
  MiyabiLineBotStack"
```

## Tasks

- [ ] Locate and fix syntax error in `scripts/build-line-bot.sh:25`
- [ ] Test build script locally on MacBook
- [ ] Test deployment from Pixel after fix
- [ ] Update deployment documentation with correct command

## Related

- Process IDs: 7c9034, 8ee27e
- Deployment successful via workaround: eb356e
- LINE Bot Lambda: `https://l7qte1iuk7.execute-api.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/prod/webhook`

## Priority

**Medium** - Workaround exists and functional
